SATURDAY, AUGUST 15@ Herbert Von King Park, Lafayette Ave.
1-8PM

Meet us in the park for a day full of celebrating Blackness, shopping local DIY vendors, live jazz on the lawn, art making for all ages, healing services, and good vibes.

On the Lawn 
1-6pm: Shop the DIY Fest. A curated marketplace that highlights the diverse cross sections of artisans of color interested in exchanging handmade goods, ideas, food, and skills in the local Brooklyn community.

1-6pm: Visit Harriet’s Apothecary for their first outdoor healing event at SoBK Opening Day! Harriet’s Apothecary is an intergenerational, healing village led by the brilliance and wisdom of Black Cis Women, Queer and Trans healers, artists, health professionals, magicians, activists and ancestors.

1-4pm: Jazz on the Lawn. Enjoy live music by Brooklyn’s own The Jeff King Band.

1-4pm: Learn, create, craft, and play at MoCADA’s Art Making Workshops! Look for the tents with the red flags. Details TBA. Activities suited for children and adults.

In the Amphitheater 
4-8pm: This year’s concert will feature Bilal, with special guests performances by NoName Gypsy, Tunde Olaniran, Nappy Nina and the Sons, and jams by DJ NativeSUN. The evening will be hosted by, Angel Nafis, poet and author of Black Girl Mansion.

results.description:
Join other spiritually minded NYC men for a non-sexual, clothes-on ritual honoring the sacred dimensions of male sexuality and desire.

Space is limited and this event is promoted elsewhere, so don't delay.  Although the event is free, pre-registration is required. See below for details.

http://youtu.be/w1OXNlyyzP8?list=UU5Dd_shqzIvEqrmbjEIrGRg

About this event

About once a month, a group of men gathers in Riverside Park, NYC for a ritual honoring the sacred dimensions of male sexuality and desire. We call it a *lingam puja* (borrowing the Hindu term).

Please note that the ritual itself is non-sexual and fully clothed. We invoke the Divine in its female and male aspects, as goddess and as god. We bear witness to one another's intentions and prayers. We name into the circle those we hold in our hearts.


We walk as a group in meditation around the Phallus and pay individual devotion to it as we're moved. We end with a final group embrace. We meet under a 200-year-old oak, with light glinting off the Hudson. It's a simple but powerful practice with room for whatever you're holding in your body and soul.

There will be a chance to spend some time together afterwards somewhere nearby.


About the facilitator

David Townsend is a gay man, a facilitator and sacred intimate committed to gay and bisexual men in our journey toward a bigger, freer, more joyful life. He keeps a blog on gay and bi men's spirituality at www.anchorholder.blogspot.com.

Practical Details

Please arrive 10-15 minutes early.

The event will be held in Riverside Park near the 116th Street Metro Station (1 Train). Instructions for finding the group will be sent upon registration.

Cost and How to Register

There is no charge for this event.

Advance registration is required by sending a message to the facilitator as follows:

1. Click David Townsend's name where it appears above as host of this event.
2. At top left of his profile, under his name, click "Send Email."
3. In your message let David know you plan to attend.

Got Questions?

You can post your questions below.
results.name: Sacred Dimensions of Male Sexuality Group Meditation

results.description:
We will try to do something different from previous meetups. Let us discuss about your own personal poetic voice. Also after discussion we will write and edit some poems.

You can read about poetic voice here https://tinyurl.com/q9xcedn

Suggested topic for poem: "Me"

We will share our experiences about how we developed a poetic voice.

Some questions to think about:

- How would you define your poetic voice?

- Is it inspired by another author or a non-author?

- If a symbol can represent your voice, what would it be?

- One poem you wish you could have written, because it is so close to your core being that it essentially feels like looking into a mirror (so bring your poem!)

- Any examples of how other poets evolved their voice

- Any other tips?
results.name: Your Poetic Voice & Creating Poetry

group.name: So you want to be a writer?

results.description:
Hello New York Singer Songwriters,

I've been a singer/songwriter in NYC for 10 years and for the past 3 and a half I have owned my own rehearsal studio in Midtown Manhattan. When I first moved to New York I took recorded sound classes, but realized that my passion was the live show and I wanted to learn about live sound to make my shows better. Now I have this knowledge and I've noticed that there are no classes offered on this topic. It is vital knowledge. I taught my first class in March this year and because it was so successful I'm now planning to do my second one on August 15th and more to follow. 

Below you will find the details and the link to reserve a spot.

I look forward to meeting you!

-Sarah

Live Sound Workshop for Performers:

Saturday, August 15th, 2015 at 1PM

Youthquake Studios
584 Eighth AVE (between 38th and 39th ST)
New York, NY 10018 

Order Now, Space is Very Limited! 

The workshop costs $75 and RVSP here to attend!...https://www.eventbrite.com/e/live-sound-workshop-for-performers-tickets-17811592954

1PM - Live Sound Workshop for Performers
4PM - Question and Answer Session with Networking

What is "Live Sound?"

"Live Sound" is a term used to describe the sound techniques utilized in a live venue when there's an audience in attendance. This expertise is different than what's called "recorded sound," which is the way music is recorded in the recording studio.

Most classes and workshops exclusively focus on "recorded sound" techniques and can leave performers without vital skills when they go on stage to perform live. If you've ever taken ProTools classes or recording classes, you are still a beginner in live sound techniques and are in need of this workshop.

Is this Workshop for You?

This interactive live sound workshop is for you if you are doing gigs (or looking to do gigs) and want to know how to communicate clearly and professionally with the live sound engineers in NYC venues.

After completing the workshop you will also be able to do basic sound for yourself if you encounter the NYC venues that require this skill. (Surprisingly, there are some great ones that have the bartender point you to the mixer and leave you to do it all yourself!)

Who This Workshop is Not For

This is not for anyone who already has extensive live sound experience. This is a beginner level class geared towards performers.

If you are not a performer you are welcome to attend, but know that the class will be taught with the performer in mind.

Skills You'll Learn

• Mic Stand Setup Tricks
• Pro Cable Wrapping Techniques
• EQ, Compression, and Reverb
• Basics of the Mixer (Also known as a "Sound Board" or "Desk")
• Much More!

Questions You'll Be Able to Answer
• Why can't I hear myself?
• Why did I just hear that horrible feedback?
• What are the different pieces of gear all around the sound person?
• We will cover as much as we can in three hours and then we will relax with some question and answer time and networking.
results.name: Live Sound Workshop for Performers

group.name: New York Composers, Musicians, Lyricists and Singers

results.description:
Ever hear a song on the radio and wonder why it sounds good? Curious as to how songwriters just seem to "know" how to put together a song? Wish you could know the tools to do it too? This program will cover the basic tenants of music theory and song structure for non-musicians who want to learn about what contributes to those beautiful, sonorous textures. This is for beginners with little to no background in music, but all are welcome to attend and share in the world of music!

This event is free. The Columbus Library is providing this space, which means it is open to the public, so get there early! 

I look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Music and Songwriting Basics (for beginners)

results.description:
Free. Manhattan. Saturday, August 15th @ 1 PM

Gotham Yacht Club is looking for fun sailors and non-sailors to join us this weekend!

We take trips around the Manhattan area in a 50-foot Beneteau. We usually sail the Hudson--the Statue of Liberty to the George Washington Bridge--but also go to Martha's Vineyard, the Hamptons and the Jersey Shore.

We like to fill the boat up with about 20-30 people. No sailing experience is required, but preference is given to experienced sailors since the trips can’t happen without them.  As space is limited on the boat, simply RSVP’ing “Yes” to an event does not guarantee a spot on the boat.  If a spot is available, you will be contacted directly with event details.

Sailors can take their first trip to get acquainted and enjoy the party.  From then on, sailors can choose to (1) work the morning shift and help out with the launch or (2) work the evening shift and help out with the return.  Generally, sailors spend less than a third of the trip working and can take the rest of the time to relax and socialize.

The current crew is made up of young, educated Manhattan professionals. We are looking to meet new people who will enjoy the atmosphere and company of everyone on the boat. 

If you and/or your friends are interested, please copy, paste, and fill out the questionnaire below in an email and send to [masked]. Please include your current email address so that we can contact you directly.  Since boat trips fill up in advance and we receive many applicants, we may not get back to you immediately.  

We look forward to seeing you on the water!

EVERY APPLICANT (REVELERS, SUNBATHERS, ETC.)

Q) Please provide a link to your page on Facebook or other social networking site. Please attach a picture if you don’t have a page on a social networking site.

Q) How old are you?

Q) Where did you attend school?

Q) Will you please tell us a little bit about yourself?

FOR SAILOR APPLICANTS

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on, but not captained, a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on but not captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) Will you tell us a little bit about your sailing experience?


Please copy and paste all questions and answers and send in an email to [masked].

Thank you!


FAQ


Q: Do you have to pay to attend a boat party?


A: No, all boat parties are absolutely free.  You may want to bring food and drinks, which are on a potluck basis.


Q: The specific location is not listed.  Where do we meet for the boat party?


A: Unfortunately, we cannot fit everyone who RSVPs to a MeetUp event onto the boat.  There are some crew members and attendees who are not part of the MeetUp group, so there may be less space than it appears.  In order to avoid miscommunication and needing to leave people on the dock, specific details (including meeting location) are sent to members individually.  If you do not receive an invitation via email, you will not be able to attend that week’s boat party.


Q: How often are the boat parties?


A: Boat parties are generally every weekend, either on a Saturday or Sunday.


Q: Do I have to fill out the questionnaire?


A: Yes! Please fill out the questionnaire as thoroughly as possible.  If you are uncomfortable posting any of the information on your profile, please email your responses to [masked].  Without a complete application, you will not be considered to receive an invitation.  The trips last several hours, so we will have 20-30 people in a confined space for an extended period of time. Therefore, we need to have an idea of who we are inviting on the boat and ensure that we have a proper crew.  Please fill out the questionnaire if you are interested in sailing with Gotham Yacht Club.

results.description:
It is important for us as students of spirituality and mysticism to become aware and acquainted with the tremendous resources that are available to us to make our lives more harmonious.

Once we learn to tap these inner resources, living will be an invigorating affair continuing and picking up where we left off in previous life experiences and thereby advancing and expanding the consciousness.

We need to keep foremost in our consciousness certain principles, conditions and laws to gain access to spiritual tools and to arrive at permanent solutions to life's challenges.

Through lectures, participation in meditation, and visualization exercises, we will be given the opportunity to experience the value of discussing these principles in a group setting.

Facilitating the discussions will be Dr. Lonnie Edwards, Vice President of the EGL Board of Directors, and author of Spiritual Laws that Govern Humanity and the Universe.

(www.facebook.com/Spiritual.Laws)
results.name: Discuss Spiritual Laws with Dr. Lonnie Edwards

This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

results.description:
>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

(Purchase a ticket soon.. tickets are limited)

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here. 

OUT PROFESSIONALS’ NEWEST SATURDAY ADVENTURE WHISKS YOU TO THE IDYLLIC URBAN OASIS OF GOVERNORS ISLAND.

On Saturday, August 15, begin your trip through time with a brief and breezy ferry ride from the tip of Manhattan. Glide past Lady Liberty en route to Governors Island, long off limits to New Yorkers.

Soon you’re nestled under a canopy of century-old trees, wandering among stately old brick buildings and enjoying camera-ready views of the Lower Manhattan skyline less than 1000 yards away.

In Dutch and British colonial times, Governors Island was pasture, timberland, game preserve and summer resort. For nearly two centuries after the American Revolution it served as guardian of the harbor and was in continuous military use.

Today it’s a National Monument and city-administered public park, where well-tended lawns play host to Revolutionary War re-enactments and contemporary art installations.

On Saturday, August 15, you are invited to join Members and friends of Out Professionals … OP.LYNX, our dynamic women’s network… and OP.PRIME, the network for up-and-coming LGBT professionals, for “Guardian of the Harbor: The Walking Tour and Mixer.” Afterwards, unwind, socialize and network back at Fraunces Tavern, where Washington bid farewell to his officers.

Out Professionals’ private Walking Tour/Mixer series is designed for us — and you — by Joyce Gold History Tours of New York. Joyce teaches Manhattan history at New York University. She has published historical guidebooks to Greenwich Village and the Financial District and has contributed to The Encyclopedia of New York City.

Tour highlights include:

Castle Williams, a circular fort built in the years leading up to the War of 1812 to help protect New York City from naval attack
Glimpses of Gatsby-era flappers and sporting gents headed for the Island’s ninth annual Jazz Age Lawn Party
Spectacular views of the Lower Manhattan skyline and New York’s harbor 

WHERE

We meet between 1:30 and 1:45 p.m. (not a minute later!) at the light-green Battery Maritime Building at 10 South Street. Look for the Governors Island slip, adjacent to the Staten Island Ferry terminal. Subway: 1 to South Ferry; 4/5 to Bowling Green; R to Whitehall Street.

WHAT’S UP

Tour takes place rain or shine. Roundtrip ferry fare: adults, $2; seniors, just $1. (Caution: Bags subject to search by security personnel. Outside alcoholic beverages prohibited and will be confiscated.) Open-ended mixer begins about 4 p.m. at Fraunces Tavern, 54 Pearl Street at Broad Street, NY 10004, a few minutes walk from the South Street ferry terminal. Refreshments on your own.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $30. Dues-paying OP Member, just $20. OP Member plus one guest, $40. The personalized nature of our tours requires that the number of participants be limited. Avoid disappointment; register now.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!

A one-year individual Out Professionals Membership (new or renewal) PLUS free admission for one to “Guardian of the Harbor: The Walking Tour and Mixer” is yours for just $80. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Tour Governors Island!

results.description:
Marjorie Eliot, who hosts her free Parlor Jazz set in her home at 555 Edgecombe Avenue every Sunday, is hosting her 23rd annual "Jazz At The Mansion" outdoor jazz performance on the lawn of the historic landmark Morris Jumel Mansion, Saturday August 15th & Sunday August 16, from 2pm - 6pm.


If you missed our meetup on December 14, 2014 at Ms. Eliot's home
(http://www.meetup.com/HarlemGo/events/219035123/), you should make one of the dates for this once-a-year event!

http://youtu.be/akE_YE_Mr3w?t=10s

Joining Ms. Eliot both days will be:
Saxophonists - Sedric Choukroun, Gerald Hayes, & Paul Ruffner
 Trumpets - Nicholas Mauro & Koichi Yoshihara
 Bass - Paul Beaudry
 Drums - Clay Herndon
 Clarinet - Lammott Cottman
 Flute - Vivian Ducat
 Poet - DFaye Anderson
 Musical Director, Piano & Vocals - Rudel Drears

<a>Our Meetup</a>

We will meetup at the Mansion from at 1:30pm for a brief meet-and-greet and/or tour the manision, then sit for the jazz concert which starts at 2pm. Sandwiches from Heights Tavern (heightstavernnyc.com) and refreshments will be served at the Mansion during the meet-and-greet before the concert and during the intermission (while supplies last).

The Mansion concert starts @ 2pm and will run until 6pm.

<a>Special Note*</a> - Although the "Jazz At The Mansion" concert, food & refreshments are complimentary, please consider offering a donation to the house when the offering bucket goes around. What you care to offer is totally up to you, but let's return courtesy with consideration. 

<a>Directions to the Morris-Jumel Mansion (65 Jumel Terrace)</a>

By Train: Take the 'C' train (local) to 163 Street/Amsterdam Avenue. Walk to 160th street and Amsterdam, make a left and walk two blocks on 160th street to Jumel Terrace. Make a left on Jumel Terrace and the entrance to the mansion is in the middle of the block. The #1 train to 157th Street (Broadway) is an alternative (similar route).


By Bus: The M2, M3, M100, and M101 all have stops nearby.

<a>As always, if you have any questions, running late, or need further directions for driving, street parking, etc. call/text Daniel at 774.275.3646. Thanks!</a>

results.description:
Get on the water in NYC!  Come experience outrigger paddling for free.

This event will have outrigger paddling.  SUP paddling may be added before the event.  Check the comments field below for updates.

This event is open to the public on a first come, first served basis.

RSVPing to this meeup does not guarantee you a spot.

However, your acknowledgement helps us plan our day to make sure we get you on the water as quickly as possible!

A completed waiver is required for participation.

Click here to fill out the waiver.

We paddle rain or shine except when there is lightening.  Remember to wear sunscreen and to bring a bottle of water in the canoe to stay hydrated. You are free to wear whatever you want provided you do not mind the possibility of it getting wet. You may want to consider bringing something dry you can change into afterwards. Assume anything you bring in the canoe will get soaked and/or lost.

The novice sessions will involve a half hour introduction on the dock to familiarize you with the technique, commands and safety protocol of the canoe. This is then followed by a 30 to 45 minute session on the water.

More details can be found at: http://newyorkoutrigger.org/novices/program-description/

DONATIONS:

One final note, you may already know that we are a non-profit 501c3 educational organization and fully volunteer based. Any cash or check donations – while not required - would be greatly appreciated and go towards funding our efforts  to continue providing New Yorkers with the experience of outrigger paddling in New York City.

Any donations can be given your land training instructor.  In addition, you can donate via our website

http://newyorkoutrigger.org/members/

by clicking on the "Donate" button.
results.name: Free Outrigger Paddling at Hudson River Park's Pier 66 - Session 6

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

results.description:
Hosted by George Ortega
From 2pm-4:30pm (It's okay to arrive late or leave early.)

This philosophy-science-religion event is about exploring the big questions in life. The answer to some, like whether the universe is infinite, may be impossible for us to know. The answer to others, like whether we continue to exist in some other form after we die, may simply await more advanced technology. Our group is more about expanding our minds through our investigations than arriving at definitive answers.

Our meetings are open-ended so we can explore whatever happens to be on our mind that day. They will officially run about two and a half hours, however members should feel free to arrive late, leave early, or stay past our scheduled end-time if we wish to extend a discussion. While rsvping is suggested, it’s not absolutely necessary. Our meetings are free of charge.

We’re here to have fun, and meet new like-minded friends. So while some of our topics may invite very different perspectives, our showing respect and consideration for each other’s views will ensure that we all have a great time. Remember that there are no wrong questions for our group, and we should feel free to present whatever topic we’d like to explore.

Here are some questions as examples of the kinds of topics we may wish to discuss; What is the purpose of life? Is there such a thing as absolute truth? What is goodness? Does God exist? What are the keys to lasting happiness? Can philosophy transform our world? Does paranormal or psi activity like clairvoyance and telepathy exist? Is our world completely material, or is there a non-physical domain? What might have existed before the Big Bang? What does the future hold in store for us? Is the universe eternal? Do aliens exist? What aspects of religion make sense, and what aspects don’t? Is euthanasia moral? Do we humans have a free will? What is intelligence? Is there an abiding personal self? What changes should our world make to ensure the brightest future? Is evolution and endogenous or exogenous process? How much different are humans from other animals?
results.how_to_find_us: We're usually close to the 55th St. entrance. Look for our Meetup sign
results.name: Exploring the Big Questions - 3rd Sat. 2-4:30pm  Sony Plaza, 550 Madison (55-56)

results.description:
Let's meetup and shoot some pool until our arms hurt, or until 8pm (whichever comes first!). Unlimited play until 8 pm for only $20! The meetup officially starts at 2pm.

Pay at the front desk and tell whomever is working the desk you're there for the meet up and they'll point you in our direction. All skill levels are welcome! I hope to see you there! : :----- : : ---- : : ----- : :

Basic 8-Ball rules:

To avoid confusion and debate, here are some good rules for playing 8-ball. These are not the APA league rules, They're not "Mike's Biker bar" rules, they are the BCA rules which govern most pro pool matches. -- The table is open (free choice of group) after the break, no matter which ball(s) are pocketed.
-- A scratch or other foul results in cue-ball in hand ANYWHERE on the table for the opponent.
-- Hitting one of your opponent's balls before one of your own on a shot is a foul.
-- Missing or scratching on the 8-ball is NOT loss of game if the 8-ball is still on the table.
-- The ball and pocket must be called unless the shot is obvious.
-- The number of cushions (or other balls) the ball bounces off need NOT be called.
-- The cue-ball or ANY other ball must touch a cushion or be pocketed after a shot or it's a foul.
-- The 8 ball must always be called.

results.description:
EXPERIENCE THE POWER WITHIN YOU!


Take A Hypnotic Trance Session with Qesankh Maa Kheperu

Change Your Life Forever!

Many of us face challenges in our lives. These challenges come in many forms and what is a challenge for one is not an issue for another. So everyone is unique and comes with their own set of experiences. But there are universal issues that we all face.  The principal ones are money, love, weight, health, and career. We are raised to believe that the way to face these challenges is through hard work and a little knowledge. But nothing could be further from the truth. This is because success is not a set formula that anyone can follow. Everyone must take their own path to getting what they want and there is no one-size-fits-all template to success.

Yet one thing is clear. Many go their entire lives working hard, waiting for their ships to come in yet with no or limited success.  Even worse, some seem to be magnets for money and success in life without putting in a hard day’s work.  But why? Is the universe unfair? On the contrary, there is rhyme and reason to the madness. First off, you must understand that to overcome challenges in your life you have to get right to the source. Unfortunately, our society is caught up in verbal trickery. What I mean by that is that many come along with PHDs at the end of their names and try to address your issues through a verbal discourse in the hope that through deductive reasoning you will come to an understanding of what is the root cause of your plight. Millions of dollars are spent on this type of discredited Freudian treatment.

But how many have been told to stop smoking, stop over-eating, stop taking drugs, stop dating that selfish person, yet they continue to do so knowing full well that what awaits them is likely to be pain and suffering. This is because verbal communication cannot change behavior no matter how passionate you are. How many preachers and ministers whose faith seems unbreakable are caught with their pants down in some type of indiscretion?

Let us examine slavery for example. Many of the chief architects of this horrible atrocity were Christians, Muslims and Catholics. But if they were holy men and women how could they have endorsed the capture and enslavement of an entire continent of people? This is because their religions relied on sermons and verbal language through scriptures as a means to try and spiritually uplift people. This simply does not work. Our ancient ancestors knew this simple truth. This is why most indigenous cultures practiced meditation and trance induction as a means to communicate directly with the subconscious mind, which is the seat of your power.  Now many are turning to hypnotherapy to control their weight, stop smoking or drug-taking, and to relieve pain from surgery or relationships.  These therapists and patients have finally realized that the power to effect change lies not in the conscious mind but rather the subconscious mind. We must realize that the conscious mind can only execute what the subconscious mind directs it to.  The effectiveness of this type of treatment has been proven in many scientific papers and studies. Yet still to this day many are unaware of the success rate of techniques such as hypnotherapy and trance induction. This is because those in control, the global elite, have imprisoned our minds in left brain externalized thinking.

HYPNOTHERAPY MADE A TERRIBLE MISTAKE


Although it’s on the cutting edge of mind therapy, hypnotherapists have made a critical error. They have treated the subconscious mind like a computer. Their psychology being what you put in is what you get out. This is untrue and demonstrates a true gap in their understanding of men and women. It was our ancient so-called primitive ancestors who referred to the subconscious mind as “the spirit” or “the indwelling intelligence”.  They knew early on that the subconscious was consciousness and was intelligent. Hence it is omnipresent and omniscient.  This indwelling intelligence doesn’t just serve to direct the conscious mind based on commands you program into it, this intelligence is responsible for everything that happens to you in the physical world. It creates the very reality you see before you.

This means it plays an active role in your life and is not just relegated to dreams, nightmares and subconscious thoughts and traumas. It is what some in the new age movement call your higher mind. It is all-knowing and connected to everything we experience.  If fact, there really is only one consciousness that we all share.  But we erroneously believe there is a division within consciousness. There is only division within our physical bodies, which separate us on this planet.

Treating the indwelling intelligence within you like a dumb computer that can only be programmed to accomplish the task it is given is to severely limit the power it can accomplish for you. Yes, it’s true you must either program it or command it to perform a task but because it is a super-intelligence it is one thousand steps ahead of your perception. In fact, when you are born it is already aware of your destiny and aligns circumstance to allow you to fulfill the objective of your new incarnation. If you do not program it, it will proceed on its own and lay the foundations for either your success or failure.  But in reality there is no failure, only experience, so what appears to you as a futile attempt is a great experience for the intelligence within. Remember, its goal is to experience reality based on the destiny you have agreed to prior to coming to this physical plane of existence.  So as it sees it there are no good or bad experiences, only information to help it grow in understanding. But this is a discussion for another time; for now we want to focus on empowering you.

YOUR SUFFERING IS A NEEDLESS ACT


We are taught that suffering is a natural part of life. In essence, no pain no gain. That we have to go through emotional ups and downs, pain and pleasure.  In most cases when adversities befall those who have tried to live a righteous life we are told that God will right the wrong done in his own time. Yet, we are never told the entire truth; that pain and pleasure are emotional states that can be triggered at will.  We simply, as a society, are ignorant of the fact that we, not some outside entity, have the ability to remove any physical or emotional pain troubling us. And also, that if needed we can summon such pleasure that it surpasses that of any drug.  These are techniques that can be learned by anyone!

Let’s look at the implications here so we can see a real picture of how society has screwed up our thinking and belief system:

·  A young man becomes addicted to drugs. His addiction causes him to lose his job, friends and the love of family members. He takes to stealing to support his habit. The urge for cocaine is so strong that he simply cannot resist it. In our society he is labeled a drug addict and ostracized. If he is lucky and not arrested for carrying the drugs he may go into a good and expensive treatment center, where they will talk him through a 12 step program.

·  A young woman suffers from poor grades in school. She tries just as hard as everyone else but can’t seem to keep up. Many of the subjects she studies are very intense such as biomechanics requiring many hours of study and research. She fails her final term paper and is forced to repeat the class. If she decides to seek help they will assign her a study buddy who will spend countless hours with her in the library coaching her through the dense material.  Her career is on the line and she must somehow pass this class while not neglecting her other classes.

·  A young man is motivated to start his own business. So he pays thousands of dollars to attend motivational seminars, business lectures and purchases all kinds of at-home programs on how to get rich. Yet, hard as he tries each business is a dismal failure.  He becomes more and more disenchanted. He watches TV or the internet and sees the success others are having and comes to the conclusion that he is just a failure in life.  Once more he dreams of meeting big investors who will fund his business. But he knows he has no such contacts in his Rolodex. He gets a regular 9 to 5 and calls it a life.

·  A man is physically abusive to his wife and daughter. He seeks help to manage his temper and the psychologist traces it back to when he was a child. They discover that he was physically abused by his father and neglected by his mother. In fact, as a child he was sent to the hospital a number of times for broken bones and open wounds inflicted by the violence. The psychologist uses talk therapy to help him realize the origin and resolution to his difficulties. But the man still has occasions or bouts of anger so he takes it one day at a time.

·  A violin player finds herself spending countless hours and thousands of dollars on training. She enjoys the music and the instrument. Through the tried and true practice of repetition she practices the same songs and notes over and over again until she has blisters on her fingers. She even forks over her life savings to hire one of the best violin coaches in the country. She dreams of being in the London Symphony Orchestra or perhaps being solo as a world-renowned player. But she knows full well that it may take years for her to get to master the instrument. And worse, she may discover that she just doesn’t have the talent for it and will have to make a decision to move on with her life. She fears being a housewife or working for corporate America. But the truth is the odds are not in her favor given the current paradigm of society and its failure on how to teach people to awaken their inborn talents. 

·  An aspiring actress looking for her big break attends casting call after casting call but doesn’t land that big role. She pays for acting classes and attends seminars on how to make it in Hollywood. She even moves to California and gets a job as a waitress so that she can have flexible hours and attend her auditions.  But the years pass and yet still no roles. Even worse with each audition she attends she is told she is not the right type. She is too old, too fat, too skinny, too short, too tall, too blonde, too ethnic looking, etc. All of this rejection takes a toll on her mindset. Where she was once a positive individual with hopes of movie fame she now realizes that success in acting eludes her. She gives up and gets a regular job, family and settles down to a normal life.

·  An attractive woman is plagued by relationship issues. She dates different guys looking for her soul mate but there seems to be no chemistry with these men.  Even worse, the guys are jerks, self centered and egotistical. She desires someone to compliment her and daydreams of the perfect mate and children. She realizes that her clock is ticking but there seems to be little that she can do. The club and bar scene is unrewarding as it only results in guys looking for one night stands. So too is the internet. She tries dating sites but the guys hype up their profile and are just looking for one thing. She has even prayed to God to help find her a good man but to no avail. She ends up becoming bitter and disenchanted. Finally, she adopts the belief that love is a myth.

·  A martial artist puts in hundred of hours of practice. She loves to spar and often travels the country competing in competitions. But she has reached a plateau and can’t seem to advance to the next level.  So she increases her efforts but can’t seem to perfect her kicks or her form. She looks around at other martial artists who perform their fights with ease, never forgetting one step. She notes that they are bigger and stronger than her and wonders if she’ll ever be at their skill level. She knows in her heart she has the fire of a lioness but something is holding her back.  Her 5th degree instructor just yells at her telling her to push, push, push! But the more she pushes herself the fewer results she sees. So she resigns herself to the fact that she just doesn’t have the natural ability that other martial artists possess.

·  A young woman finds herself in a terrible position. Everything she eats no matter how little increases her weight. She looks in the mirror and realizes she is severely overweight. However, she can’t stop eating. So in an attempt to handle the situation she tries several fad diets. At first she loses some weight, which makes her feel good. However, in almost no time she regains the weight again and her self-image and self-confidence plummet. Even worse she realizes that when she goes out with her girlfriends guys no longer approach her. She tries diet pills but they don’t work either. Finally, she takes out a gym membership but finds it hard to make the time to go to the gym after work. She knows that being overweight is a health risk but she feels there is nothing she can do. She wants to accept the notion that big is beautiful and accept her full-figured self. However, she often spends Friday and Saturday night at home in deep depression.

As you can clearly see all of the case studies above have two things in common: the reliance on verbal communication to get a person to change his or her behavior, and the dependence on physical means to address their problems. If one were to examine the statistics we would see that such treatments are a dismal failure. But then one may ask why is it that some people have effectively quit smoking, shed weight or stopped drinking? Is this not proof that verbal talk does work?  No, this is because the emotion and desire to change in those individuals penetrated the conscious mind and tapped directly into the subconscious mind effecting true change thus manifesting their desires.  But not everyone has the knowledge to be able to do this nor are people aware enough to be able to reproduce the formula or effects. In religious circles this change is often mislabeled as being born again or God saved me. In secular circles it is attributed to a person’s own drive to change all the while never realizing that the change came after they bypassed the conscious mind to communicate and commanded the subconscious mind to make the radical transformation.  What folks failed to realize is that the power was always within them and the reliance on outside entities such as pills, gurus and books only served to make things more difficult.

Now what I am advocating here is by no means a quick fix. But it is a lot easier than spending hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars trying to overcome a bad habit, emotional issue or learn something new. What we teach is so powerfully effective that you will notice the results overnight. We’re talking about giving you not only the ability to overcome what is currently challenging you but to empower you with the ability to succeed in any aspect of your life.

YOU’LL HAVE THE POWER


And do not forget that the net result of your efforts is not just the impregnation of information but the ability to tap into an awesome power that can align the forces of physical reality at your command. This is God’s true blessing and the reason why you don’t have to continually beg him for the things you need in life. He has given you the power to get them and more. Imagine if you will having the power to reshape the world to give you the things you need. This is why our approach is so different.

In this extraordinary program you will be taken into trance induction where we will remove any block, emotional fears, addictions, and provide you with powerful suggestions to get better grades or excel in your chosen career or sport.  Lastly you will learn how to perform miracles through synchronicity by attracting all the things you want in life. So powerful is this technique that you will never look at reality in the same way again. Stop trying to achieve your ambitions by physical means alone: let us show you a new world and reality where magic happens. Sign up for a free session to experience your power within!

Qesankh Maa Kheperu is known throughout the country. Here is what his technique can do for you:

·  Help you to overcome any bad habit

·  Eliminate addictions of all kinds

·  Overcome emotional trauma

·  Eliminate everyday stress

·  Overcome depression

·  Improve performance in your career or sport

·  Enhance your learning and memory ability

·  Improve your grades

·  Overcome shyness

But that’s not all. Because your spirit is all power and connected to everyone and everything, Master Teacher Qesankh Maa Kheperu will work with you to tap into your power to accomplish the following:

·  Through synchronicity align circumstances to be at the right place at the right time

results.description:
Would you like to be healthier and more relaxed and joyful…….letting go of stress and the burdens of a busy mind?

If so, come and join us for the Open Heart Meditation and Reiki Tummo energy balancing treatment. You will feel more relaxed and peaceful as Divine energy is channeled to everyone simultaneously.

What is Reiki energy healing?

Reiki is a simple way of channeling high vibration energy for healing purposes for ourselves or others. It clears blockages in our energy channels so that our physical body can be healthier. The practitioner does not use his/her energy, but is just a channel through which the energy flows. Reiki Tummo goes beyond traditional Reiki in that it is not just a healing modality, but also helps us to grow spiritually by opening our spiritual heart which is our connection to the Creator. Reiki Tummo also uses kundalini and earth energy for a deeper and gentler acceleration of cleansing and spiritual growth.

What else do I need to know?

Donations are gratefully accepted, but if you can't donate please feel free to come. Space is very limited so register early. Repeaters are always welcome. You may bring interested guests.

Open Heart and Reiki TUMMO Alumni can join for free.

Please note that this is not a Reiki circle to channel Usui.  You will be experiencing Reiki TUMMO by Padmacahaya alumni only.

Call Ann at[masked] or email by 9am @ [masked] for more information

Heart Smiles,

the NYC Group

results.description:
Get on the water in NYC!  Come experience outrigger paddling for free.

This event will have outrigger paddling.  SUP paddling may be added before the event.  Check the comments field below for updates.

This event is open to the public on a first come, first served basis.

RSVPing to this meeup does not guarantee you a spot.

However, your acknowledgement helps us plan our day to make sure we get you on the water as quickly as possible!

A completed waiver is required for participation.

Click here to fill out the waiver.

We paddle rain or shine except when there is lightening.  Remember to wear sunscreen and to bring a bottle of water in the canoe to stay hydrated. You are free to wear whatever you want provided you do not mind the possibility of it getting wet. You may want to consider bringing something dry you can change into afterwards. Assume anything you bring in the canoe will get soaked and/or lost.

The novice sessions will involve a half hour introduction on the dock to familiarize you with the technique, commands and safety protocol of the canoe. This is then followed by a 30 to 45 minute session on the water.

More details can be found at: http://newyorkoutrigger.org/novices/program-description/

DONATIONS:

One final note, you may already know that we are a non-profit 501c3 educational organization and fully volunteer based. Any cash or check donations – while not required - would be greatly appreciated and go towards funding our efforts  to continue providing New Yorkers with the experience of outrigger paddling in New York City.

Any donations can be given your land training instructor.  In addition, you can donate via our website

http://newyorkoutrigger.org/members/

by clicking on the "Donate" button.

results.description:
Modern Ruin: A World’s Fair Pavilion tells the story of Philip Johnson’s New York State Pavilion from the glory days of the fair, through many years of neglect, up to present day advocacy. 

The filmmakers have succeeded in engaging and informing audiences about the building in new and exciting ways. This whimsical, futuristic, and soaring structure, an important relic of the 1964 fair, has been left abandoned for the greater part of 50 years. 

“It would be a shame if its story ended in demolition,” says producer Matthew Silva, “The dreamers see beyond the cracks, rust, and neglect to a thriving community space that will serve New Yorkers for generations.” 

The film’s goal is to contribute to the re-imagining of Flushing Meadows Corona Park and eventually lead to the re-purposing of this great icon. 

The film will.

Screening followed by Q&A with the filmmaker Matthew Silva.

Afterwards: 

Having just seen this film about the New York State Pavilion, you bet we will take the time to walk around it. It looks so proud - almost new recently.

We will then go to one of six great restaurants near Flushing Meadows.

Pay Richard $2, when you see him, keep this community going on. Thanks.

New friends welcome.
results.name: "MODERN RUIN: A World's Fair Pavilion". See this important documentary.

Access the webinar here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email. 


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>) 


----------------------------------------------------------------

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-FREE Class-(Online Webinar)

results.description:
I keep an eye on the weather and the field.  In the case of inclement weather - I try to make a determination as early as possible - preferably 24+ hours in advance, or by noon the day of if it's still questionable.  If we are not meeting, I will actually cancel the event page and send out an email.  If you are not signed up to receive emails, check the site, or text me[masked]


Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc.   If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF.  If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...).  If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.



What is Ultimate Frisbee?  In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee.  You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Montclair)

results.description:
This is a walking tour in Central Harlem. Join us and explore the word-class visual vocabulary in the largest neighborhood of Manhattan. We will explore it's storied past, interesting present and visualize the promising future of this dynamic community.

Itinerary:

• The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture 
• Harlem Hospital Mural 
• Abyssinian Baptist Church 
• Strivers Row (architectural gem of the community) 
• Harlem's Walk of Fame 
• The Apollo Theater 
• And Much More 

We will explore these and more sights using the visual links immediate to the location.

Reservations:
Required. You must RSVP. If the walk is full you can go on the wait-list. Please, if you RSVP and later realize you will not be able to attend change your reservation ASAP.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide (Juan J.) in front of the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture by 2:50pm. Map here. Walk concludes at the Apollo Theater; map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!
results.how_to_find_us: Participants meet with the guide in front by the entrance of the meeting location.

Women Of Integrity Updates:


How are you? I hope all is well. Women Of Integrity, Inc.'s 5th Annual BBQ is coming up on August 15, 2015. It will be at 3:00pm-9:00pm at Roosevelt Park. The park has been renamed to Reverend Arthur Mackey, Sr. Park. Directions: Take Southern State Parkway to Exit 23/Meadowbrook Road (Not Meadowbrook Parkway South). Take Meadowbrook Road to Washington Avenue. Make a right onto Washington Avenue traveling west to Lakeside Drive (Across from the United Cerebral Palsy of Nassau). Make a right onto Lakeside Drive and go to the park entrance on the right.

We are excited to Announce that Affinity Health Plan, has partnered up with us to provide FREE face painting for the kids. Urban Beauty Enterprises is also a sponsor for this year's BBQ. Our annual BBQ is a potluck theme. We ask everyone to bring a dish or a beverage. We are looking for food sponsors and raffle prize donations. We will have great raffle prizes and will be giving out awards to businesses in the community. If you haven't done so already, please check out our new  website. It's www.womenofintegrityinc.org or check us out on www.facebook.com/WOIINC.

Looking forward to seeing everyone at the BBQ. Thanks again for your continued support. We are Destined For Greatness.!!!

results.description:
All right gang. A Saturday afternoon of trivia at Cosi on 31 Street & Park Avenue South. Starts around 3:30 pm. The Boggle meetup will be winding up by then. Games scheduled to be played include:

VITAL STATISTICS - a game of multiple choice, higher/lower and fill in. Get 10 right before everyone else and you win.

REMINISCING - a game about decades, from the 50s all the way to the present. A team game. We'll pair people up for this one.

WITS AND WAGERS - all the answers are numbers. Guess the answer closest to the actual answer without going over and you win chips. You can bet on your answer or someone else's answer.

BELIEVE IT OR NOT - about the odd and bizarre. No questions about any of the candidates running for President.

So there you have it. The 28 and 33 Street stops on the 6 train are the closest subway stops.  RSVP and get in on the fun!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in the back
results.name: Saturday Afternoon Trivia - Cosi at 31 St. on Aug. 15

results.description:
“MoCADA’s Soul of Brooklyn Festival is back for another exciting week of live music, wellness workshops, performances, film screenings and great shopping! Centering African diasporan arts and culture, the fest highlights the creatives and black businesses that make our borough ‘the planet’.

Meet us in the park for a day full of celebrating Blackness, shopping local DIY vendors, live jazz on the lawn, art making for all ages, healing services by HARRIET’S APOTHECARY, and good vibes.

On the Lawn

1-6pm Shop the DIY Fest. A curated marketplace that highlights the diverse cross sections of artisans of color interested in exchanging handmade goods, ideas, food, and skills in the local Brooklyn community.

1-6pm Visit Harriet’s Apothecary for their first outdoor healing event at SoBK Opening Day!

1-4pm Jazz on the Lawn. Enjoy live music by Brooklyn’s own The Jeff King Band.

1-4pm Learn, create, craft, and play at MoCADA's Art Making Workshops! Look for the tents with the red flags. Details TBA. Activities suited for children and adults.

In the Amphitheater

4-8pm This year’s concert will feature Bilal, with special guests performances by NoName Gypsy, Tunde Olaniran, Nappy Nina and the Sons, and jams by DJ NativeSUN. The evening will be hosted by, Angel Nafis, poet and author of Black Girl Mansion."

View the full week-long schedule of Soul of Brooklyn events here: http://mocada.org/soul-of-brooklyn-festival-2015/ and check out this recap of last year's event:

https://vimeo.com/111207203

Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches in the middle on the left inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.

results.description:
For this meet up, we will be discussing feminism within minority groups. The articles below discuss the reasons some minorities may feel left out by feminism. I would love to talk about these articles, and ways we can bring attention to issues affecting minority groups.

As a black feminist, I see how the wider movement fails women like my mother: http://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2013/dec/09/black-feminist-movement-fails-women-black-minority

Race is a feminist issue: http://www.sparksummit.com/2013/01/01/race-is-a-feminist-issue/

2013 was a big year for feminism, but the movement still alienates minorities: http://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2013/dec/16/feminism-minority-voices-2013-inclusion

OverView:

Although Unity3D is most commonly used as a game engine, the fact that it is so easy to use and configure makes it ideal as a general purpose rendering engine—without digging around Open Frameworks or wrapping your mind around pure OpenGL. Unity has been used by many developers as a quick prototype tool, and by others as their final engine of choice. 

Sam Eng, an independent game developer (snowhydra.com) aims to show you the general ins and outs of adopting Unity3D as a flexible, easy to use graphical powerhouse for non-game applications, interactive or not.

<a href="https://scratch.mit.edu/"></a>
results.name: Unity3D as a flexible rendering engine

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: A Conversation About Happiness, Citicorp at 53rd and Lex.

results.description:
The starting point is Maya. What is it? What is on the opposite side of it? Is it possible to verify existing theories of what constitutes Maya? How is it presented in Buddhism and Hinduism? Is it really that great of a concern? Should we fear Maya or welcome it? What are the tangible advantages/disadvantages of this concept from the standpoint of daily living? And how about from the standpoint of the philosophies that present it?

This is a cozy but comfortable location with a large selection of pizza, really low-key and intimate. There are a few round tables and a good twenty people would fit comfortably.
results.name: Let's discuss Maya

results.description:
MEETING DETAILS SENT OUT 4:30 PM ON FRIDAY BY E-MAIL TO ALL THOSE WHO RSVP'D. IF YOU DO  NOT RECEIVE, CHECK SPAM, CONTACT ME IMMEDIATELY, DON'T POST A COMMENT AND SEND ME YOUR PERSONAL E-MAIL ADDRESS AND I WILL RESEND TO YOU.

PLEASE READ THIS CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU RSVP. WE’LL BOTH BE BETTER OFF THAT WAY.

I like to do this event twice a year and one of those times is on a late summer evening.

Join me and AMC Club members who do not have to RSVP-unless they do not get last minute e-mails from the Club through Yahoo- on a fast paced, fun five mile exploration of all of Roosevelt Island. This is an interesting but weird little island-which will be undergoing significant change in the very near future. We will visit the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Four Freedoms Memorial Park, we’ll see some old ruins, the “Octagon” (which has an amazing spiral staircase) and is now an upscale residential building but was once a “lunatic” asylum and many other places and we’ll talk very briefly about what we see. There are always surprises along the way. The waterfront views are really great. We will meet BEFORE  5:00 P.M. We will finish around  8:00 P.M. WE LEAVE PROMPTLY. No food stops. 

I WILL SEND AN E-MAIL WITH MEETING DETAILS THE EVENING BEFORE  THE EVENT.

Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup. Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC Club members there is NO need for AMC Club members to RSVP for this-UNLESS you do not get last minute e-mails about Club events-and you should in order to fully take advantage of your membership. Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate. If you have been a NO SHOW on any AMC Meetup event that I have led –see your attendance history-or you are a chronic abuser of the RSVP process, please do not RSVP because I am just going to delete it.

I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You will have all the information you need to do this once you get the meeting place details. No offense, but I don’t need to know what you are doing that day (and probably neither does anyone else) if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather is really bad or there is a really bad forecast, Check Accuweather like I do, I will post a notice on the day of the event cancelling. If there is no notice, we go.
results.name: Sunset Expedition on Roosevelt Island

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:

results.description:
BlackLightBall, it's like regular indoor soccer but under the BlackLights and with music!! This is our Monthly BLB event (3rd Sat of the Month) at this location. 

This is a fun laid back social event. You can come later if that fits your schedule better, no problem.  We will have music playing, there will be healthy snacks and drinks, and we will be playing indoor soccer till the sun goes down. Once it's dark enough we will switch over to BlackLightBall for the rest of the evening. You can play as much or little as you like. When you get off the court and you would like to play again just get back into the line. Otherwise if you like, take a break, eat a snack, socialize, and watch others play a game. It's all for fun and to raise funds for Street Soccer USA.

WHITE T-SHIRT IS A MUST.  (Shorts, socks, shoes - the more white or fluorescent colors the better)
BRING INDOOR SHOES OR SNEAKERS.
PINNIES WILL BE PROVIDED but sometimes you will be wearing just the white shirt.

Street Soccer USA's unique court with walls and medium sized goals creates a very fast paced and exciting match! 

Rules:


8min games

Fun Play 

No Sliding 

Game restarts from goalie 

Kick-ins.. no throw ins

Corner kicks 

Directions:

By Car - Cross the RFK Bridge and take the I-278 exit towards Randalls Island. Turn right onto Central Rd until it turns into Hell Gate Circle. Turn Right crossing under the RFK Bridge onto Sunken Garden Loop.  Help SEC is across from Fields 90-91.  Use the comments section to arrange carpooling if you like. Typically there is at least a group doing a car pool from the Court Square/Murray Playground area in LIC.

By Bus - Take the M-35 bus which leaves from 125th St and Lexington Ave in front of the Duane Reade. It is the second to last stop on the bus route. 

By Train - Take the 4-5 train to 125th St. Transfer to the M-35 bus.

PS2G promotes clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.


The fee is  $10 via paypal, (includes insurance, permit, security guard) 100% of the proceeds go to Street Soccer USA. Learn more about our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Street Soccer USA is sports for social change. Using our entrepreneurial instinct as well as evidence based practices, we make a measurable difference in the lives of undeserved youth in urban areas and special needs populations, including homeless families, adults, people in recovery, among others.

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game. 


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? Go take jujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.


If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play. 

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers Help USA nor Street Soccer USA are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

Your guide selects only the best underground clubs and bands performing on that particular night - and all cover charges are included in the tour price. We move from club to club (at least 3 clubs per night) seeking out the energy and excitement for which the Village jazz scene is famous. We intersperse the live music with lively and interesting insights into the Village's rich jazz and social history. The tour starts relatively early, so you'll be shocked to find out how much great jazz is being performed by masters and innovators in this neighborhood's below-the-radar scene. No lines, no crowds, just amazing live music - up close and personal.

More info and tickets here - https://goo.gl/9xNH6M

results.description:
"I feel like I acquired a semester's worth of knowledge in one class! Instructor made learning really fun and cared about the students having a great experience. A+" M.S.

Beginner: Improving Your Drawings

* This Meetup is structured as a drawing class. It is limited to 7 students. 

This class is for you if you are relatively new to drawing and want direction on how to proceed. This class is for beginners and for people who consider themselves beginners.

Each student receives personal instruction and technical advice based on their drawings during the session. 

The Class:

1) We will begin with a short Q & A session where we answer some common questions:  Do I begin with one tiny piece or do I try to get the whole image on the paper? How do I make sure things fit on the page? How do I draw more in proportion? etc... 

2) Together we head into the galleries to work on our first drawing exercise. I will sit with each student to discuss their work and make sure the lesson is understood and effective.

3) We meet briefly to discuss our work, ask any questions and get our next exercise. 

4) We set out to draw again. And again I visit with each student to talk about their work. 

5) Finally we meet to discuss what we have learned and answer any final questions. 

Students should bring a drawing pad, a 2H pencil, a HB pencil, a 4B pencil, an eraser and a pencil sharpener. 


If you have any questions please feel free to email me. 

Simon

Museum admission is not included in the event cost. Museum tickets are suggested only and you may pay as much as little as you wish.

results.description:
Union Square Speak-Out in NYC  is something that I miss. It gave people the opportunity to vent but also share knowledge that, even to this day,  is hard to find online.

So, with the help of WRASK Inc, (www.wrask.com) we are bringing the Speak-Out back to NYC.  

What is a Speak-Out. The 14th Street Speak-Out resembles an ordinary open mic. It will encourage us to share our expressions (thoughts, poems, lessons learned and experiences) that we need to get out.  It could be personal experiences that's beneficial to other and many times it's things going on in the community that isn't getting media attention we needs to be known. 

The biggest difference with a speak out and especially with our speak-out is that we want to build a community; a movement that will encourage each other with empathy and promote positive progression through sharing knowledge.

The event will also be streamed live at http://www.wrask.com 

Come out and share! 

Your experiences and expressions matter!

*If you have any questions, please leave a comment.
results.name: Speak-Out And Share Our Thoughts

results.description:
Akbar Palace-Authentic Cuisine of India
47 West 55 (5th and 6th Street)
Saturday, August 15th
6:45 pm optional drinks, 7:45 pm dinner
$52 Indian feast, glass of wine, coffee, tax and tip

One of the big fads in food for the past few years has been Indian food. I hesitated to initially try Indian because of the spices and family style aspect, but some members have asked for it and since we found a place that will make our dishes not spicy, made-to-order and non-family style, we thought this would be an ideal spot for our first Indian restaurant, on their Independence Day! Our appetizers are a mixed combo plate with lamb, chicken, shrimp, samosas and other Indian classics, along with the best homemade naan that I have ever eaten. We have entrée ch0ices from chicken tikka masala in a tomato cream sauce, chicken pistachio korma, lamb shahi korma in a creamy nut sauce, lamb spinach curry, salmon tikka, shrimp masala or seafood curry. results.description:
We'll get started with this month's meeting with some fun eats, cappuccinos, tea, and wine, while we mingle, and connect with fellow like-minded entrepreneurs.

We’ll then move into the main focus of the evening with our guest expert for this month, Michael Roderick. He will share how to Effectively Communicate and Network to Grow your Business.


A little bit about our expert:


When Michael went from high school teacher to Broadway producer in under two years people started asking him how he managed it.  Eventually, he decided to develop a workshop on networking which grew into a full-time consulting practice and that became Small Pond Enterprises.

Most recently, Michael founded The Connecting Connectors Conference (ConnectorCon).

Looking forward to seeing everyone.  Seating is limited, so please only RSVP 'Yes' if you can make it.  See ya soon!

Christina
results.name: Effective Communication and Networking to Grow your Business.
