results.description: Paulaner NYC is a German Restaurant & Microbrewery. This is a fun place with a Bavarian look. It is style like a beer hall with large wooden table in the middle of the restaurant. If you like traditional German food, this is it. Of course what can be better then German style beer brew inside the restaurant itself. For our non beer friends, cocktails are available here. A main course here is about $24. You can also get sausages & sandwiches which is about $13. Each couple is responsible for the cost of their own meal. The owner has been contacted and has agreed to give seperate checks for each couple. Please be aware that most seating is at the large bench tables which has no backing. Area is easy to get to by train or car. Cool yourself off for a fun time summer night!
results.name: Paulaner NYC

results.description:
As our social and cultural environment changes, the vocabulary of symbols that emerge from our psyche has evolved with it. In an increasingly urban life experience, archetypes take on new forms. Philip Williamston took on the task of searching and representing these new faces of archetypes. 

A graphic artist from the Pratt Institute, he shares his artistic work and called it URBAN ARCHETYPES. It comes in the form of a 82-card suite. These cards can connect more instantaneously to urban dwellers, as he assigns new faces to The Empress, the Magician, the Hermit etc. His work ushers the archetypes directly to the experience they represent. Philip Williamston will be sharing his work with the Mythological Roundtable Community. 

These visionary cards are a fountain of insight for those interested in the Tarot and archetypes in general. In his words: 


“…My family felt the effects of [ the artistic and cultural struggle against racism and repression that began at the end the Civil War]. When my father survived an attempted lynching in North Carolina and in 1948 we migrated to New York City. Since I was very young, I was drawn to the study of the Arts and I have followed that calling through Pratt Institute, the CBS Network and Columbia University. The Urban Path cards are the result of a 12-year vision quest in response to that same calling.”
results.name: Urban Archetypes: Reimagining Symbols for the Present Era

results.description:
The stars have aligned for the Birthday Cellaboration=(Collaboration + Celebration) of two musical Lions (aka Leos)!

Join us for what will be an extraordinary night of fantastic music, warm people, dancing, surprises & give-aways!


DJ Line-Up:

7:00pm-8:40pm - Ed Funk & Musa

Ed Funk:

There is no better way to start the night than with the flawless go anywhere (and still sound awesome) mix-show flavor of the ultra-professional Ed-Funk! 

Musa:

The master of the blend! You haven't heard a song till you've heard it played by Musa. Expect to hear everything you know like you've never heard it before, blended in a way that will make you dance your culo off!

8:40pm-10:20pm - Chill Kechil

The 1st Birthday set & the public premiere of his new track "Fly"! Chill has carved out an intoxicating laid back sound that simultaneously titillates. You will hear originals, brilliant remixes and alluring selections uniquely crafted together. Chill will move your heart and FEET!

10:20pm-12:00pm - Boxxy Brown

The 2nd Birthday set of the night! Boxxy's mixing style is comparable to improvisational jazz, every set is a sonically unique experience that is created in the moment. He will be building up the energy until the clock strikes midnight, marking the official start of another exciting year in the life Boxxy Brown.

12:00pm-2:00am - Mak-Len


The Paris native is the perfect DJ to end the night. Mak-Len is an open channel of unbridled energy and puts every ounce of it into his craft. Whatever your troubles they will be gobbled up in his wave of skilled enthusiastic mixing & cutting. He brings his passion directly to the dancefloor!


Birthday Gifts!!! :-)


Because the birthday boys believe everyone should get gifts at a birthday celebration, everyone in attendance will be receiving a special gift from Chill Kechil & Boxxy Brown at 8:30pm!

You will not want to miss this.. and if you're not there, you don't get one... sorry.. best to show up early because what Chill Kechil & Boxxy Brown want most is you being there to celebrate and enjoy this special night with them!!


Details:


This party is open to any member of #NYCDMN (and their friends) who want to have a great time, listen to fantastic DJs & join in the characteristic friendly outgoing #NYCDMN atmosphere.


Due to the exclusivity of this intimate splendid party location we will be cutting off the guest list at 100 people including DJs. First #NYCDMN members to RSVP will receive the invites.


Invites will be sent out Monday, August 10th and will require confirmation. Due to the limited invites available please only confirm if you will definitely attend.

We don't want someone else to miss out who would like to be at this party, tks.

SEE YOU THERE!!!
results.how_to_find_us: Please give your name at the door for verification and they will direct you to the party.
results.name: Chill Kechil & Boxxy Brown's Birthday Party Cellaboration! (BOX o' CHILLed Wine)

Let's all get together and introduce ourselves and discuss future plans for meetups.

f you can't get a parking place in the Shannon Rose lot, park over in the Target lot and walk over


When you come in through the doors go to your right and at the end go through into the next room and we will have the high tables in the middle of the room. When you arrive tell the hostess you're with Mark's meetup group.

We will have our own server for the entire night so you don't have to go queue up at the bar every time you want something.  It will be individual checks and gratuity.  If I see the hostess bringing the majority of people through, then I will suggest a group gratuity for them

I look forward to meeting everyone on Saturday!

results.description:
Dancing is a great way to meet people!  This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker.  It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro.  This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.  

Gain confidence in social dance situations and learn the skills necessary to either blend in or stand out on the dance floor.  

Must prepay here to confirm spot (limited space available) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Aug-15-2015_at_0730PM

Professional 1 hour lesson from Monika Matys (Get Dance), that will teach you how to dance at a club/party (80s, 90s, Top 40). We'll work on dancing with rhythm, musicality, coordination, and groove... to the best dance music!

This lesson also includes admission to our after party immediately following, where you will be able to practice the moves you just learned! 

1st 15 tickets available for $15 ($20 after that) Must Prepay - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Aug-15-2015_at_0730PM

This is a Multi-Meetup event.  Expect 20-30 members to attend.  It is not meant to be age specific or gender balanced.  

See more info about the after party here - http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Social/events/222217073/
results.how_to_find_us: Lower level of venue
results.name: Learn How To Dance (Includes FREE entry to 80s & 90s Party after) PREPAY ONLY

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Saturday Night? This event Saturday night is for men and women at The Wheeltapper Pub.

At present we need women (and only women) aged 25 to 32 although there's a little flexibility in the age range. Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.

Grab friends and come along to Nirvana to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance. Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me (i.e. from <a>[masked]</a>). If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

regards, Daniel
results.name: email danielb1035@gmail.com

group.name: New York City Free Speeddating Group

results.description:
Ken Crawford is sponsoring this dance to celebrate his 69th birthday.

New to contra dancing? This dance is ideal for meeting friendly people, celebrating Ken's birthday and learning how to contra dance--all courtesy of Ken. The caller Ken has arranged for is Bob Isaacs--a national-class caller, famous for teaching newcomers how to glide through a whole contra dance in just a few minutes. 

Beginner's workshop starts at 7:30; the dance begins at 8 PM. Fee is $5, or free to those who attend Ken's free Playshop (http://www.meetup.com/East-Hanover-Contra-Dance/events/221776031/), which will be held from 3 - 6 PM the afternoon of August 15, i.e., earlier the day of this contra dance.


Ken also encourages a small donation in support of Swingin' Tern.
results.name: Let's contra dance to Bob Isaacs and Quarters on the Machine

results.description:
Dear holistic singles:

I am truly honored to be able to present to you, Jamie Petrizzo, Career Counselor and very successful entrepreneur as our Guest Speaker next Saturday night, August 15th. Jamie is highly intelligent,  deeply caring, creative and very intuitive. Jamie is going to share how to write an extraordinary profile that will attract the kind of person that you wish to attract to you. 

Here is what Jamie will cover:

Pictures...What to post and how to post the right kind of pictures.

Age and Height... A frank discussion of your options


How to get a bigger response to your profile initially, and then after the first week or so.


What to request as your criteria in search


What to say that will make you intriguing and make someone identify with you.  It's different for men than for women.


How to paint the picture that will present you in the best light.

****Jamie is happy to review your online profiles!! Kindly rsvp yes asap if attending and send them to me at [masked]. 

**Please note that Newsday advised that our event will be published this week. Ads were placed in Natural Awakenings and Creations. As such, rsvping yes on this site and sending your profile sooner is a good idea!


Join us if you wish to connect with like-minded community. If you are actively searching for love or partnership online, or need a bit of inspiration to do so. 

There are many holistic and spiritual dating sites online now that have people who share our passions, values and interests.

Looking forward to seeing you next Saturday night in Port Washington. Please park at the Town Dock and walk a few blocks away from town. At Inspiration Wharf, cross the street. We will be greeting you at The Graphic Eye Art Gallery!!

We are looking forward to seeing you next Saturday night! Dress in a way that makes you happy!

All the best,

Carol Leitner
results.how_to_find_us: Jamie and Carol will be greeting you at the door.
results.name: How to Write an Extraordinarily Attractive Online Dating Profile

results.description:
Dear holistic and health-oriented friend: 

I am so excited to be hosting our first Carol's Holistic Singles event on Saturday, July 18th in Port Washington. It is so important for singles community to meet LIVE. So many people who are looking for love and/or great friendship are growing tired of doing so online. There is nothing more satisfying than LIVE energy and LIVE connection.

I am happy to offer you a great LIVE evening: a fascinating guest presenter, Tori Quisling, and an opportunity to socialize and get to know people who share your passion for Mind-Body-Spirit health and share your other passions in life.

Come alone or come with friends! It will be a very warm, welcoming and friendly environment.

Look for this article in July's Natural Awakenings and join us on July 18th!

New: Carol's Holistic Singles' first event on Saturday, July 18th in Port Washington! How to Create The Relationship of Your Dreams and Greater Abundance in Your Life

Carol Leitner, MBA of Carol's Holistic Services is delighted to present her first Holistic Singles event this year! Carol is deeply committed to the holistic community as evidenced by her two Meet Ups:

Holistic Living on Long Island and The Wellness and Entrepreneurs Exchange having grown to over 1300 health-oriented members.

Carol previously ran Conscious Singles' Connection and also Singles with Spirit. The mission of this new singles' organization is to provide a place where health-oriented people find romance and also friendship/partnership/companionship so that they can lead higher-quality, more enjoyable lives. Carol wants to bring people together who are fascinated by the Mind-Body-Spirit connection. Together for romance, or for exploration of holistic health, exploration of Long Island, New York City, Europe, etc. Life is just more rich when we have people with whom to share it! Be it with a life-partner or with a good friend!

Carol is delighted to have Tori Quisling, Founder, New York Center for Clairvoyant Development, and featured in CBS New York News, NY Daily News and the TODAY Show, as the first guest presenter. Tori will be presenting on How to Create the Relationship of Your Dreams and How to Create Greater Abundance in Your Life .

In this interactive presentation,Tori will be teaching us clairvoyant techniques to assist us to create both greater relationships and abundance! And will be offering on-the-spot readings.


This kick-off event will take place at the lovely Graphic Eye Art Gallery, 402 Main Street, Port Washington, across the street and down the block from Louie's, very close to the town dock. 7:30pm-9:30pm


$25 including program for the evening and healthy refreshments

RSVP required by Wednesday, July 15th, by contacting Carol at [masked] or at[masked] 8270. $30 after Wednesday, July 15th.

Please also rsvp if yes on this Meet Up site.

Thank you for reserving as soon as you can. It makes event planning so much easier!


**Note that the first 10 people to rsvp will get a FREE copy of Tori's book entitled Clairvoyant Practitioner: A Practical Guide to Developing Your Clairvoyant Abilities.


Looking forward to a great event on Saturday, July 18th! Hope to see you there.

 Carol Leitner
results.how_to_find_us: We will be welcoming you at the door!
results.name: NEW..Join us at Carol's Holistic Singles event

results.description:
Texans fans!  I've met some of you at my bar Double Wide over the years and am stoked to be your temporary home until 25 Avenue B reopens as...guess what...NYC's newest Tex Mex cantina!  You died and went to heaven, right?

This first meetup will be a casual gathering on our bar side at Double Wide, with specials like:

- $5 Queso

- $4 Shiner and Lone Star

-$6 Tito's

We'll check out the 2015 Texans lineup on the big screen, reunite some fans, and probably answer many questions about the upcoming Tex Mex joint in your old favorite spot.  With a band of local Texas transplants (& fellow meetup members) creating a delicious casual menu with our NY-based Double Wide alum and main owner, Josh Gent, you're in good hands!  Think enchiladas, combo plates, brisket tacos, and queso for days.  Opening is slated for September, so we'll keep this group in the loop on all events!  Hope to see you at Double Wide until then...

results.description: hudson river museum  outdoor movie night ..come see Raiders of the Lost Ark     This  is a free outdoor movie  . The movie starts at 8 pm  but aim to get their a bit early  to find parking  in the marina and walking up the hill to the amphitheater the seating is stone steps which they give you a thin pad  but it can become uncomfortable so maybe a chair is a better option . if your going to sit in a chair be mindful of not blocking  people's view from behind you  although it stadium style seating so it shouldn't be an issue  .  This  is  a classic adventure movie  fun for the whole family  .  what better  movie for the westchester adventures to see then this  so bring a friend and enjoy the night out under the stars and see this old movie in a fantastic new way

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

venue.name: NORTH STREET TAVERN @ The Maple Moor Golf Club

results.description:
COME JOIN US AS WE GO "WILD IN WESTCHESTER" FOR A NIGHT FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, DINING, DANCING, AND ADVENTURE AT OUR  SOIREE UNDER THE STARS AT THE NORTH STREET TAVERN!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING SINGLES FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING BY THE GREEN.

11 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

MEET SINGLES FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING OVERLOOKING THE MAPLE MOOR GOLF COURSE.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP ONLY!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

BRING A FRIEND

Bring someone you know, a friend, a neighbor, a fellow co-worker or grab an ex-relationship and get down to one of the best Social Mixers around!

THE MUSIC

DJ Radio Personality, Matt Zako will be <a>spinning top</a> 40 and Retro tunes and taking your requests starting around 9 PM in the main dining room. We'll have all your favorite dance tunes playing so there's something for everyone's musical taste!

COVER CHARGE

There will be a $5 cover at the door for this event regardless whether you're dining or just at the bar.

Please pay as you arrive and <a>exact change</a> will be appreciated. Thank You!

PARKING

We have all the convenient Parking you'll need right in front of the restaurant. After parking enter through the side door.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

Just 30 min. from Norwalk, 40 min. Danbury, and 20 min. from Stamford.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!
results.how_to_find_us: PLEASE R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE AND TRY TO HAVE EXACT CHANGE AT THE DOOR, THANK YOU!

results.description:
This event is for people who are single and looking in the 25 to 45 age range.  Our regular events are geared towards  people looking to expand their circle of friends and consist of both single and coupled members.  There have been many request for singles events, so this is one of our few events that is for singles who are looking to mingle. 


 Note this is posted on multiple groups including the Hoboken Social Sandbox.


Cost:

 The cost is $7 if you pre-pay by 8/15/2015 (5pm), or $10 (cash) at the door.  All of our members will get a wrist band to be included in our event and get food and drink specials all night long.

  You can  pre pay for the event by:

======= CLICKING HERE ========

 There are no refunds for pre payments unless the event is cancelled in which case, all pre payments will be refunded in full.

 Our food and drink specials are:

$4 Drafts
$3 House wine
$3 House mixed drinks
$3 Fireball shots
$5 Jameson shots
$6 Sliders
$5 appetizers
 - Single order of Wings
 - Mac and Cheese Bites
 - Mozzarella Sticks
 - Broccoli Cheese Bites
 - House Salad
 - Guacamole and Chips

 How It Works:

 We will be in the private downstairs room and I will be wearing a glowing  pendant (to make it easy to spot me). I will be checking everyone in and giving you a wrist band. We have name tags available if you want one, but this is optional.

Questions:

Do I have to talk to everyone at the event?

  You are expected to be polite to everyone at the event but don't have to spend a significant amount of time talking to any one individual. You should try to talk to as many people as you can but not monopolize the time of any one person. If you find yourself talking to someone and want to move on to the next, simply say "thank you, It's been a pleasure talking to you, but I need to mingle with some more people now".

 Understand that the goal is to mingle with a lot of people so expect that people will be moving around a lot. This is normal and healthy.

What do I do if someone will not leave me alone or acts inappropriately?

 Most people know how to socialize and we take great pains working to keep creepy people out of this group, but every once in a while there will be one who can't take a hint. If you find yourself being unduly bothered by someone please report this to me (Mike) and I will take care of it. Note that being overly aggressive and/or making other members uncomfortable is a sure fire way to get kicked out and banned from the group.

What if I am shy and find it difficult starting a conversation with people?

 Everyone at this event is there to meet the other members and other people are likely just as shy as you are. Everyone with a wrist band is part of our event and the normal protocol is to introduce yourself to strangers.  The only "Pick up line" you need is "Hello my name is <insert name here>". you will find that it is very easy to talk to others in the group.

 If you need a little help ask me to introduce you to some people as I love introducing people to each other to help break the ice.

See you there!

-Mike
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the private donwstairs room and I will be wearing a glowing pendant.

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

group.name: Bushwick Inlet Brooklyn Coed Soccer Meetup

results.description:
Update: I have secured a table towards the back of the bar, right outside the room where everyone will be dancing. There will be a sign there saying "Meetup." You can use that as a meeting point. Come join us for a FORRO dance party on Saturday, Aug.15 in Gowanus, Brooklyn. The bar has a brand new back room just for dancing. 

This event is free!

Start time is 8pm with a suggested end time of midnight, but if there are still people dancing, we can stay until the bar closes!

The venue is a cozy local bar with reasonably priced drinks, awesome pizza & grilled cheese sandwiches (if dancing gets you hungry) & friendly bartenders. Closest trains are R, F & G to 4th Ave/9th St.

This is open to the public, so while you will definitely meet others in this group & be able to practice your Portuguese, this is not a typical Meetup where we will have our own area. You'll have to try to find others in the group & meet new friends along the way! :-)

Looking forward to seeing you there!

results.description:
*** Get your tickets HERE! ***

Dewey, our improv instructor, and his husband Douglas are appearing at the NYC Fringe with their show. Let's all show some support by attending the OPENING NIGHT performance!


Once you sign up here, you will have a DISCOUNTED ticket.
I just need at least 10 sign-ups, so that I can get the group discount. I will refund you if we don't hit 10.

=================================


ABOUT THE SHOW

A foul-mouthed force. Like seeing Martin and Lewis if Dean was a sexy, seven foot torch singer and Jerry a stroke survivor. Quick-witted improv. Merrily musical. Racially offensive. Totally tasteless.


MESSAGE FROM DEWEY


As you know, Douglas and I are appearing at the NYC Fringe with our show. We are so freaking excited about this run. It could mean some serious notice for Lady Winifred and Didi Panache.


We are trying really hard to fill the 118 seats for our OPENING NIGHT performance (and the after party!) The more people we can get in to the first show, the more word of mouth we get from the start of the festival.

Also, if a reviewer comes to our first performance (fingers crossed!), and we have a room filled with our closest fans and friends, we’re bound to do well.


Will you come? We are asking you to commit now to buying a ticket for two reasons:

1) The reason I just mentioned
2) The show that sells the most tickets in the venue receives an ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE at the fest! (They call it “FringeFave!”)


Douglas and I would LOVE to make that reward show happen.


Please come to our OPENING NIGHT performance! It’s going to be quite an event!

Thanks so much for your kindness and support.


Dewey
results.name: The Lady Winifred & Didi Show (FringeNYC)

results.description:
Hey guys - it's been too long since I've seen any of you....let's rock out next Saturday!!  Below are the deets on the show, we can get $5 tickets with the code LiveMeet.  Who's in?!


Theatre Rock, Thru the Ages is the sixth show in the series and marks the first in the new Hybrid Club, at 669 8th Ave, between 42nd and 43rd Streets. The concert performance will be Saturday August 15th, at 9pm. People are encouraged to arrive early to enjoy the many $5 drink specials being offered. 


Theatre Rock celebrates the dynamic genre of rock musicals through the years. Covering the best music from the 1970's through today, the show delivers a powerful and meaningful performance not to be missed! James Grausam guest hosts this musical journey. Featured vocalists include Dan Vissers, Dave Murgittroyd, Lindsay Lavin, and Carol Wei. Joe Andolino is music director and plays keyboard, alongside Kosaku Nakamura on guitar, Tynan Hooker-Haring on bass, and Jason Gianni on drums.


Aug. 15th, 9pm
The Hybrid Club
669 8th Ave. (btw 42nd & 43rd)
Enter through the TIMES SCARE Haunted House
www.showgoesonproductions.com
[masked]

Theatre Rock Live has toured the tri-state area, and is currently in residence at Toshi's Living Room. To hear and see a preview of their awesome performances, check out their website at www.theatrerocklive.com.

The ROCK TONIC series was launched to promote indie artists through interactive and multimedia music events. Each concert integrates a story line or concept with theatrical elements and video designed to gently provoke the senses.
results.name: Rock Tonic Concert

results.description:
The Lightsaber Battle is coming back to NYC and this time it's going to be bigger and better than ever before! Choose from several different Lightsabers and be prepared to battle it out til the end! There will be no mercy granted here.

This is a friendly event with a massive turnout expected to appear. Choose your side of the force and join the ultimate nocturnal showdown.

For every $5 you contribute you receive your very own Lightsabe that changes up to 6 colors and is about 3' long. We will meetup and discuss which team you would like to join. Be prepared and dress accordingly, this should be a fun night full of surprises. The battle will be split into the two sides, so feel free to bring all your friends and either all fight together or apart! Let's make this an interesting and exciting night.
results.name: Lightsaber Battle 2015

results.description:
This event is for anyone that loves playing Air Hockey! We will be holding a fun, double elimination tournament, which basically means that even if you lose the first game, you still can play your way back to the finals! 

Starts at 9, show up a little early to sign up and for tips and tricks from the event host! Entry will be $5, you're responsible for your own games ($1 each). Payouts will be determined by how many people join, but the winner takes most.


Invite your friends, and let us know if you have any questions!

results.name: Air Hockey Tournament!

Super Smash bros (WII U) on SATURDAY NIGHT at Action Burger.  Bring your friends, bring your custom controller, eat some good food and have some fun on a SATURDAY NIGHT in Williamsburg Brooklyn. On the second tv will be either Anime, Blind date marathon or another Smash Bros, depending on how many people show up. 

https://youtu.be/Q_4eQZepbPk

Optional $30 open bar for 3 hours (11pm-2am) includes:


Open bar Drinks:Unlimited 16oz:  Black Island ice tea, Chocolate mint, Sex on the beach, Watermelon paradise, Action Peach fuzz, Peach ale Martini, Orange Waves, Coconut splash, Raspberry ale, Rum & Coke, Vodka & orange juice, Cranberry & Vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, Ginger Ale & Vodka, Ginger Ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple juice & Vodka, pineapple & Rum. 

Unlimited shots (Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Scotch).

results.description:
Host:   Mike Clancy  [masked]    Silver Dodge P/U

Starting 7:30am sharp.

Meet at the main parking lot adjacent to the Bear Mtn. Inn.  It's normally $8 to park but we may be entering before the attendant starts. 

We will be ascending the Major Welch Trail and descending on the AT.  People who have done the Breakneck Bypass Loop will find the ascent on Major Welch to be comparatively strenuous, but the descent on the AT to be much more pleasant.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2+ hours

Map:  http://www.visitbearmountain.com/files/603/BearMountainTrailMap.pdf

This hike offers  outstanding views up and down the Hudson River and the Bear Mountain Bridge.

*** possible parking fee *** It would be $8 if there's still an attendant at that hour, but that's doubtful

Please don't be late - we start on time.  We will meet in the main lot close to the Bear Mountain Inn.

+


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
results.name: Sunday at McLaughlin park 8:00 AM

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

HOW TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be responsible to attend. You can pay in cash on the courts with Terry on court #5.

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

Bob Wachtel leads our group reading; our new book is Nirmala's "Meeting the Mystery," which is available as an e-book. (You do not need to read in advance or even own the book to participate.) We focus on reading the text aloud and absorbing its meaning for us at that moment. Contact Bob for further information.

This group segues into our usual meditation at 9AM at the same location.

results.name: Pre-meditation book group: "Meeting the Mystery" by Nirmala

results.description:
What: Hike along the Old Croton Aqueduct, connecting the Rivertowns of Hastings-on-Hudson, Dobbs Ferry, Irvington, Lyndhurst and Terry town. At Irvington we'll take a guided tour of Washington Irving house.
Terrain: level, flat and shaded walking path
Distance: 5 miles RT from the Hastings on Hudson station
( 134 Southside Avenue
Hastings-on-Hudson, NY, 10706)
to Terry town station (1 Depot Plaza
Tarrytown, NY, 10591)
Hiking pace : from 2 to 1.5 miles per hour
Meeting time and place: 
9:20 train from Grand Central or 10:02am at Hastings on Hudson train station
“Meet me under the clock” of the Grand Central Terminal Station information booth, located in the main concourse area.
I suggest arriving at Grand Central station at 8:30am so you'll have time to buy your ticket (there is often a line).
We have to get 9:20am metro-north rail road tickets to Hasting on Hudson staition NY.
We will aim for the 4:00 pm train from Terry town back to Grand Central Terminal.
My cell: #[masked]
Cost: metro-north rail road is about $17
Washington Irving house museum tour is $7 (optional) Car drivers:
Please, write in your RSVP if you are driving and from where and if you're willing to offer a ride to fellow hikers
We'll meet at the Hasting on Hudson station at 10:00am

Please, wear the proper shoes and attire for a hike in the woods. (No high heels etc.) Please, bring water and bug repellent. Also, somewhere along the way, we'll have a picnic, so bring snacks or light picnic food.  At Irvington we'll try delicious and extremely cheep pizza
results.name: Old Croton Aqueduct Trail

results.description:
Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.
results.how_to_find_us: Be sure to check the site for those who have signed up. We're usually easy to spot.

WHAT: Jeet Kune Do & Knife Fighting Training

WHERE: Regular meeting place.

WHEN: Every Sunday from 8:30am until 10:30am unless noted otherwise.

WHY: Utilize JKD training drills and JKD core concepts and apply them for Self-Defense

HOW: Dynamic Progressive Training

Space is limited so please RSVP Participants must be 18 yrs old or older

results.description:
For anyone who wants to test the waters, this is the Scuba Discovery Program. It gives you a glimpse into what you can expect to see in the underwater world as well as what you could expect to learn in the Scuba Diver Course. You will be shown the basic safety procedures for scuba diving under the watchful eye of an instructor. You will learn skills like equalizing your ears, buddy checks, basic buoyancy control, underwater communication and an introduction to basic scuba equipment and scuba skills followed by an underwater dive in the pool. If you enjoy this experience then the Open Water Scuba Diver course is your next step.

Need more info? Call the Dive Center[masked]

What's Required?

• A curiosity about scuba diving

• A swimsuit and a towel

If you have a mask, snorkel, and fins, bring them.

If not, we'll loan you ours – we will provide everything else!

If all spots are filled get on the waiting list we may run a 2nd session that day

Cost: $25.00 Click to Pay Now! (Get back a $25 coupon for Lessons)

Just bring a bathing suit and towel and leave everything else to us!

IMPORTANT:

Please print and complete the following three forms to bring to the pool

• SDI General Waiver for all Courses

• SDI Medical Info Waiver

• Student Information Form

Please note that the entrance to the pool where "Try Scuba" is being held is located in the rear parking lot of the Lodi Boys and Girls Club.

Become a Premium Member Learn more...

results.name: Sunday Morning Tennis

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

results.description:
Here's another one of those bike rides you don't want to miss. And one of the best on our short list of great rides.

This is 29 miles--mostly on paved bike path, but partly on city streets--around Manhattan Island. We'll start at 9 am in Battery Park after taking the ferry from our parking spot on Staten Island. We'll head up the Hudson River Greenway (it's like a highway for bikes) and go under the GW bridge. We have to cross some city streets at the top of Manhattan, but they're marked off with bike lanes. Then it's down the Harlem River and the East River (with some more city streets on the way) through South Street Seaport and back to Battery Park.

We'll see some amazing views of skylines and bridges... and some parts of Manhattan that you've probably never seen. Bring a road bike, mountain bike, or hybrid. It's mostly flat with a few hills at the north and east sides of the ride.

The whole ride, with stoppage time, should be about 4-1/2 hours. We can plan a pub lunch at South Street Seaport if anyone is interested.

RSVP early to let us know how many people we'll be coordinating. And, as usual, invite friends!

Click here to view the route map. 

TERMS OF PARTICIPATION 
By registering and participating in this Big Weekend Adventures event, you acknowledge that you have read and agree to the following statement: 
I understand that bicycling involves certain dangers and risks which I am prepared to assume for myself and all children accompanying me. I will abide by all traffic laws and regulations and agree to bicycle in a safe and prudent manner. In addition, I agree to waive all claims which I, or any member of my family, or my heirs, executors or assigns, may have against Big Weekend Adventures or its agents for damages or injury sustained as the result of participating in a Big Weekend Adventures activity.

For a list of safety guidelines, visit:www.bigweekendadventures.com/terms-of-participation/

results.description:
Supposed to be another great Summer day, so come out and play. Bring your racquet and some lightly used or new balls and we'll rally and play some doubles.

Weather: Check back for any cancellations due to poor weather or otherwise.

Transit: 6 train to last stop at Pelham Bay Park and short walk. BX5, BX12 and BX29 within walking distance.

• Court number/location will be announced in comments upon arrival.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Hi everyone! Another member and I have planned a beautiful route (and I mean beautiful) for this coming Sunday. This will be an awesome ride! You must attend.

The trip will take us through Harriman SP, Hawks Nest, Minnewaska SP which offers some of the most famous windy (twisty) roads with spectacular vistas. 

We will get close to the Catskills area and will cover about 250 miles round trip.   There will be several stops along the way so everyone can enjoy the scenery, stretch their legs, answer calls of nature and of course, take pictures (so bring your cameras!) A lunch stop will be planned somewhere in the halfway mark. Most likely pizza in Port Jervis.

Feel free to bring a light snack and water with you if you can carry them.  The weather forecast for Sunday is hot and humid.  There is a gas station near our starting point so please remember to fill up before we head off.  Meet at 9:00 for a brief group meeting.  9:30 kickstands up and away we go.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Environmental Portraits tell a story about a person, a chef cooking, a dancer stretching, a Soccer player with a ball under his arm, etc. Great for fashion, editorial or just family and friends. NYC hipsters are cropping these into Environmental Headshots.

In this workshop we’ll learn how to compose interesting backgrounds and then throw them out of focus in order to tell a story while concentrating on our subject. 

We will be using our cameras in manual or aperture preferred mode in order to control depth of field, so "take it off program" and get creative. 

I've just updated the Workshop Notes and you can download them free:

http://arcaimaging.com/Environmental_Portraits.pdf


Above done while I was a photo student. Mamiya RZ (6x7) normal lens. Film: Agfa Scalia. 

Above is a couple I did for my friend LanVy, completely staged for her fashion line. I didn't have an assistant to handle the reflector so I used an on camera flash with a slight warming gel.  We'll cover this too.

Above is an environmental portrait of a homeless poet I met in Harvard Square. (Not staged.) 


Above, a very handsome Adriatic wanderlust obsessed traveler wearing a very tacky tropical style shirt  (completely staged). 

Above, shoe stall in Sri Lanka Market (clearly not staged).

Environmental Portrait of a "Floating Community" I captured in Viet Nam (nothing staged here). 

Fernando was able to line up some fantastic models, the cost of the workshop will be $15.00 (fifteen bucks) in order to compensate our models with professional prints. 

Peter Lindbergh is really the master of this sort of image. Here’s a quick google search Lindbergh’s work. 


https://www.google.com/search?q=peter+lindbergh&rlz=1C1CHFX_enUS630US630&espv=2&biw=1284&bih=636&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ei=FzZjVey8IcqcgwT_moHwBQ&ved=0CAYQ_AUoAQ

Above is a test photo from Harbor Island Park, Mamaroneck, NY taken on July 10th, 2015.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

HOW TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be responsible to attend. You can pay in cash on the courts with Terry on court #5.

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description: Hello All, Please join me for this fun and informative training course delivered by Shane at Frontline Health (http://www.frontlinehealth.com) Starting at 10am and lasting 3hrs at a private residence (please email me [masked] for my full address). Light food and drinks will be provided, a $5 is included in the price for refreshments. Full price $50 per person. If there is a need to cancel your your attendance prior to the event the fee will still apply unless we are able to find a replacement attendee. Overview; The First Aid and CPR Party for Participants will learn to provide CPR and relieve choking as well as identify and care for a variety of medical emergencies, including bleeding, burns, muscle bone and joint injuries, seizure, stroke, and many other sudden illnesses. This course is intended for new or expecting parents, their family members and friends, and for family members of patients at risk for sudden cardiac arrest, and anyone who wants to learn basic rescue skills for loved ones. This course features hands-on skills practice. No Certificates will be issued. If there is significant interest in this course I may double up and hold another in the afternoon. Please indicate if you are interested even if the attendee limit has been reached.

results.description:
Posting on behalf of my friends Kateryna and Baris.  THEY ARE HOSTING AND ORGANIZING THIS EVENT!

Dear Friends,

Hike beautiful Gertrude's Nose (open level) to Help us Rebuild a School for 600 children in Gorkha region of Nepal using eco-friendly and earthquake resistant Earthbag technology.

Gertrude's Nose is a great loop hike that runs along dramatic cliffs of Shawangunk conglomerate, with exceptionally fine views. 

Time: 5-6 hours Length: 8 mile Route Type: Circuit Level: Open

To learn more about School project and Earthbag technology watch this video we produced after my trip to Nepal after the Earthquake and visit our website: www.goodearthnepal.org

https://vimeo.com/134576726

 Suggested donation: $20

You can donate cash or check at the hike or do it online:

Click here to donate: www.goodearthnepal.org

We are a Non-Profit Organization and Your donation is tax deductible.

Volunteering options are also available in Nepal in November 2015, so come to the hike and we will talk.

Transportation to the Hike:

Option 1: Drive to the hike

Option 2: We are renting a van to provide transportation from/to Manhattan. The round trip transportation cost is $40. If you need spot in the van please make a payment through PayPal to [masked]. The pick up time: 8:00am Location: 9th Ave & 35th Street. Please be on time.Option 3: Bus from Port Authority to New Paltz

About our EARTHBAG school project:

We have visited a school that was turned to rubble after the earthquake. We are committed to rebuilding this school using earthquake-resistant, cost-efficient and green Earthbag technology. We have already built a model Earthbag house in the same village where the school is.

School Details: Location: Tandrang village, near Aurghat in Gorkha. 600 children. 13 classrooms out of 15 have been destroyed. Children are currently studying in tents and makeshift shelters.

This is how the school looks now:

Our work in Nepal After the Earthquake:

We have been organizing trekking trips to Nepal for over 3 years and have developed strong relationships with local community leaders from Gorkha.

Immediately after the earthquake we collected $10,000 in emergency relief funds and traveled to Village Masel, in Nepal's hard-hit Gorkha Region.

In the village square I met with the village elders and townspeople, and distributed money to 45 families (5 families from each of the village’s 9 wards), so they could build temporary shelters to protect them from the rain.

Our current project

We almost finished a Model Earthbag house for a window with 2 kids who lives in the same village where the school is:

Construction Process: (for a complete process, follow us on Instagram:

www.instagram.com/goodearthnepal

COME, HIKE AND MAKE A DIFFERENCE FOR 600 CHILDREN!

**********************************************

DISCLAIMER:

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events. You are responsible for bringing the proper gear including maps, and knowing your way in and out of the areas we operate in.
results.name: Gertrude's Nose Hike for Nepal: help us rebuild a school

results.description:
The Met currently has 18 Van Gogh paintings on display...So let's go see them!

Bonus #1:  One of the paintings is double-sided, so it's really like seeing 19 paintings!

Bonus #2:  Today is the last day of the "Van Gogh:  Irises & Roses" mini-show that focuses on four of his flower paintings.


We'll start by meeting in the American Wing Cafe for a quick round of intros over coffee.  Next, we'll head to the galleries and check out the paintings.

Which do you like or not like?  Which is your favorite?  Which do you connect to?  Why?

The paintings are displayed more or less in 2 clusters, on 2 different floors.  We'll view them at a leisurely pace--no need to rush through. 


Attendees are responsible for paying for their museum admission and for any purchases from the cafe.  The Met's suggested admission is $25, but you may pay whatever you wish (which the admissions desk will accept with good cheer).

Wear comfortable shoes!  :-)

If something comes up and you can't attend, please change your RSVP status as soon as possible.  Given the small size of this meetup group, no-show's would be a big loss.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the American Wing Cafe, Charles Engelhard Court, first floor (Room 700 on Met's map).  Look for table with red Meetup sign.
results.name: View a Van Gogh Marathon at the Met Museum
