results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 37-47 -2F/3M SPOT LEFT

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

results.description:
The acclaimed César Award-winning, French New Wave actress Bernadette Lafont appears in her final starring role, PAULETTE. Brash and opinionated retiree Paulette lives alone in a housing project on the outskirts of Paris. One evening, upon observing some mysterious dealings outside her building, Paulette discovers a surprising way to supplement her meager pension: an unlikely but successful career selling cannabis. But when her success draws the attention of rival dealers and the police, Paulette will need to use every ounce of her resourcefulness. Inspired by real events, this crowd-pleasing comedy shows it’s never too late to make a career change. http://cohenmedia.net/films/paulette

--------------------
Having been on vacation for the past two weekend I wanted to get back in the swing of things and schedule two meetups. It seemed like a slow week for interesting foreign films but with a little digging I found this film and theater. We will attend the 5:15 show on Sunday.

I hope you can make the showing. It should be a lot of fun. Try to make post-film drinks afterwards. I do not know the area so I am up for suggestions.

I will be outside about 20 minutes before showtime to meet up with you. Please come early to get your ticket. I do not know the theater size so it cannot hurt to get your ticket early.
-John

https://www.citycinemas.com/paris/film/paulette

results.description:
On Sunday, August 16th. From 5 – 8pm, husband/wife musical duo, Francine Evans & Joel Zelnik will present, ‘ALL THE WAY – The Best of Francine & Joel” at the “76 House”. The “76 House” is located at 110 Main St., Tappan, NY. Dinner reservations:[masked], www.76house.com. There is no cover for this event.
This performance features favorites from the popular repertoire of "Francine and Joel Music" from which Francine and Joel perform over 125 engagements annually. Songs from such diverse artists as Elton John, Frank Sinatra, The Carpenters, Bill Evans and Judy Garland are included. Visit: www.francineandjoelmusic.com.
Longtime Cloister residents, Francine Evans & Joel Zelnik have a lifetime of experience in all styles of music. Francine taught herself piano in two hands at the age of 3. She has produced 100’s of shows for children and adults, most recently, “DESTINATION: Las Vegas – The Musical Journey” which played for over 5 months in NYC. She has appeared with big band in just about every hotel ballroom in NYC and has performed internationally. She holds a M.A. from Montclair State University.
Jazz great Dr. Billy Taylor, was the first to give air play to Joel Zelnik’s first jazz album, “MOVE”, which was reissued in Japan. A contemporary of Bill Evans, Joel has entertained 5 presidents, is a pianist/bandleader for thousands of events, and has performed at concert venues internationally. NYC venues include: Windows On The World and The Rainbow Room. He has recorded four CD’s and holds a B.A. from New Jersey City University and a M.A. from Rutgers University. His latest recording, “Live At Steinway Piano Gallery” was released in Japan and the U.S. Visit Joel’s website at: www.joelzelnik.com.

Come and enjoy a good meal along with fine entertainment!

results.description:
A $5 *DEPOSIT* is required to RSVP, which will be *REFUNDED* *IN* *CASH* ten minutes after the event starts.  No-shows and latecomers forfeit their deposit.  The deposit will be refunded electronically to people who change their "Yes" RSVP to "No" more than 24 hours before the event.

This time we'll be going to Gigino at Wagner Park, a fine Italian restaurant next to Battery Park.  We'll be outside, but under cover of a giant awning so we'll be OK if it rains.  The Statue of Liberty will be viewable from the table.  A menu is here.  A vegetarian pasta dish can be had for $18, one with meat for $20.

----------------------------------------------------------

Europe has a severe illegal immigration problem.  People are being smuggled into southern Europe across the Mediterranean Sea in droves, even though many of them die in the attempt.

Many of them are fleeing violence and atrocious regimes in places like Syria and Eritrea, but a large fraction are seeking economic opportunity.  From the Economist:

Mali’s economy grew 7.2% last year. But Mr Boubacar wants out. “No matter how hard I work, I’m doomed. My father did not have a regular salary, I don’t, nor will my children.” No job lasts longer than a few months, no place in school is assured, no gain is safe from theft. Economic anxiety is mixed with fear of political violence. Half of Mali fell to Islamic extremists three years ago. A French-led intervention pushed them back, but no peace deal has been signed, and terror attacks remain common. And Mali is far from the only country in the region to be threatened by political instability... The forces that move a man to economic migration today could make him a refugee tomorrow.

And all the time pictures of seemingly attainable prosperity glisten on the television screen in the back of Mr Boubacar’s café. The vision can seem like a mirage, but everyone knows someone who can attest to its reality. A man sitting outside the café says he has heard of several people who have made it all the way to Europe and sent back glowing reports.

A plane ticket from South Africa to Sweden costs about $600, while the migrants are paying thousands to take an open boat across the Mediterranean.  So it would be much cheaper for these people to fly, but the airlines won't let them on their planes because when the refugees would arrive in Europe and be refused visas, the carriers would have to ship them back at the firm's expense.

If the EU promised an immediate visa to anyone who arrived there, the migrants would fly and the carnage in the Mediterranean would end.  But there are billions of people living in countries where the quality of life is appalling, and if any significant fraction of them were allowed to immigrate to Europe, they would change the continent beyond recognition, almost definitely for the worse.

----------------------------------------------------------

About 1 in 7 women are raped at some point in their lives, 1 in 5 if you include groping victims.

Occidental College in California has been having trouble handling cases of rape that occurred on campus.  First, they failed to expel a known serial rapist, then after having been criticized for that, they swung too far the other way and expelled a student for having drunken sex that was clearly consensual.

The state legislature of New York has passed a "Yes means Yes" law that requires students on all college campuses in the state to receive specific affirmative verbal consent prior to every time they touch each other.  Some are advocating that the law extend to non-students.  Be sure to watch the video of a couple making out by these rules -- is this the future?

----------------------------------------------------------

Arguments in favor of drug legalization abound.  We'd eliminate a lot of organized crime if people could get their drugs legally, we'd be incarcerating a lot fewer people, and we could raise revenue by taxing them (and they'd still be cheaper than now, when they're illegal).

The piece is one of the rare ones supporting the war on drugs.

THIS EVENT IS NOW SOLD OUT FOR MEN. WE HAVE SPOTS FOR WOMEN ONLY.

results.description:
Big, beefy, burly, tough . . . and I’m talking about the wines.  Let’s try some reds from Umbria. 

Landlocked Umbria, the only Italian wine region with neither a coastline nor an international border, is often overshadowed by its more celebrated neighbor to the west, Tuscany.  It’s long been associated with the easy, uncomplicated whites of Orvieto, based on the workhorse Trebbiano grape (here called Procanico) and the more aromatic Grechetto.  Indeed, Orvieto still accounts for 80% of Umbria’s DOC production. 

But Umbria’s red wines are getting greater attention, thanks to new investment in the region and the influence of consulting oenologists.  Sangiovese is the principal red grape, with increasing plantings of Bordeaux varietals, used in blends in the manner of Supertuscan wines.

If Umbria has its own distinctive, signature grape, it’s Sagrantino.  It’s an ancient variety found exclusively in Umbria, particularly around the hilltop town of Montefalco.  It was cultivated by Franciscan friars and was long used for sweet passito wines, which are made from grapes that are dried to concentrate their sugars.  After years of declining production, Sagrantino has enjoyed a revival since the 1980s, increasingly used to make powerful, dry red wines.

Sagrantino is a thick-skinned, late-ripening varietal that is thought to have the highest concentration of tannins of any wine grape.  It produces robust, long-lived wines with a dense concentration of tarry, black fruit flavors.  In Rosso di Montefalco wines, the Sagrantino is tempered by blending with Sangiovese, and sometimes Cabernet or Merlot, resulting in an accessible wine suitable for early drinking.  Sagrantino di Montefalco DOCG wines, on the other hand, are required to be at least 95% Sagrantino, with 30 months of aging before release (at least 12 months in oak barrel).  These are formidable, somewhat polarizing wines.  Some drinkers find the tough tannins exhilarating, for others they are just too much.

In this tasting we’ll try two whites made in Umbria by famed Italian wine dynasty Antinori.  First the San Giovanni della Sala Orvieto, made up of half Grechetto, a quarter Procanico, then some Pinot Blanc and Viognier to add some complexity.  Then their big, Burgundian Cervaro della Sala, in which the barrel-fermented Chardonnay is softened with a bit of Grechetto.  This is considered one of the great white wines of Italy.

Then two Super-Umbrians—a Cabernet/Sangiovese/Montepulciano blend that is the retirement project of a certain Italian sports-car maker.  Then an excellent and unusual example of Cabernet Franc (blended with a bit of Montepulciano)—it has the trademark Cab Franc minerality, but with greater ripeness and intensity than you’d find in Chinon or Bourgueil.

Then the big guns—two wines by Montefalco pioneer Arnaldo Caprai, who is largely responsible for the Sagrantino revival in Umbria.  First the Montefalco Rosso Riserva, in which Sangiovese is given extra backbone by a dose of Sagrantino, then his 100% Sagrantino Collepiano, aged two years in oak.  Then another Montefalco Sagrantino by Antonelli from an older vintage, so we can see if a little extra time can tame the big tannins.

Some of these wines were obtained on sale for substantially less than the standard retail prices, so this tasting represents an excellent value.

For more on these wines:

http://www.antinori.it/en/26-generazioni/castello-della-sala/san-giovanni-della-sala-2014

http://www.antinori.it/en/26-generazioni/castello-della-sala/cervaro-della-sala-2012

http://english.lamborghinionline.it/pagine/torami

http://www.arnaldocaprai.it/

http://www.sagrantino.us/index.html

We’ll be dining a little more upscale this time, at L’Apicio on East 1st Street.

http://www.lapicio.com/#address-block

2014 Antinori San Giovanni della Sala Orvieto  $20

Not rated.  From the winemaker:  “50% Grechetto, 25% Procanico, 25% Pinot Blanc and Viognier.  Brilliant in color with greenish highlights. The nose expresses fruity notes, particularly peach, pineapple, and citrus fruit. The structure and the acidity fuse in perfect balance with a savory and vibrant aftertaste of fine length and persistence.”

2012 Antinori Cervaro della Sala  $42

James Suckling 96 – Extremely rich and attractive aromas of cooked apple, toasted oak, meringue and yogurt. Full-bodied, rich and round with a fabulous balance between acidity, toasted oak, coconut and dried fruit. Lovely apple tart and custard pie. A blend of Chardonnay and Grechetto. This is so beautiful now.

2008 Arnaldo Caprai Montefalco Rosso Riserva  $45

Wine Advocate 91 – The 2008 Montefalco Rosso Riserva, a blend of 70% Sangiovese, 15% Sagrantino and 15% Merlot is delicious. It is also the most overlooked wine in the Caprai range, as most of the focus here is on Sagrantino. Firm tannins support a core of expressive dark red cherries, earthiness, tobacco, smoke and licorice. Elements of rusticity will always remain, but there is no shortage of personality. Anticipated maturity: 2015-2023.

Tanzer 90+ – Inky purple.  Deep, refined aromas of smoky dark plum and ink complicated by botanical herbs (here the Sagrantino dominates).  Very dense and rich but fresh too thanks to vibrant acidity, which lifts the deep black and red fruit flavors.  Turns massively tannic towards the back on the long finish; this can certainly be cellared for a few more years.

2009 Arnaldo Caprai Sagrantino di Montefalco Collepiano  $26

Wine Advocate 93 – The 2009 Montefalco Sagrantino Collepiano offers a modern interpretation of a traditional wine once made by monks. The extra oak intensity leads to soft tones of chocolate, dark cherry, and spice. This wine ages in barrique for 22 months. Each producer finds his or her own way to tame the brutal tannins of Sagrantino. One way Marco does this is with oak. Anticipated maturity: 2015-2025.

2007 Antonelli Sagrantino di Montefalco  $20

James Sucking 94 (2011 review) –Wow, what a wild nose, with freshly cut flowers, spices, and blueberries. Love this nose! Full bodied, with amazing fruit and balance. Amazing for the money. Best ever from here.

James Suckling 95 – This is really something. I loved a few years ago but now it even more amazing. Full and velvety with superb fruit. It's soft and decadent with meat, berry and bark character. It goes on for minutes. Great wine. Reminds me of a great Côte Rôtie.

2010 Lamborghini Torami  $19

Wine Advocate 92 – Another racy red, the 2010 Torami (50% Cabernet Sauvignon with Sangiovese and Montepulciano) is a gorgeous wine with thick extraction and pretty fruit tones of black cherry, plum and dried blackberry. Softer notes of lavender or dried rose fill in the back, giving way to heavier aromas of chocolate and espresso as the wine aerates in the glass. Sweet oak tones and exotic spice complete the package. Drink: 2014-2022.

2011 Tenuta Vitalonga Phiculle  $20

Wine Advocate 90+ – Super dark and inky, the 2011 Phiculle exhibits a large frame and loads of plush blackberry and cassis syrup that wrap around the palate. The blend is 90% Cabernet Franc and 10% Montepulciano, aged 15 months in oak. The Maravalle family as crafted a huge a bold and impenetrable wine that will withstand more cellar aging. Drink: 2015-2022.
results.name: Umbria

This meetup might involve some traveling, but Oprah has been nice enough to open her home to us and it is over looking the beach in the Rockaways and she has a nice balcony that we can eat on. You can make a beach day out of it :-) 

Beaches....Summer.....Fresh Herbs.......

For this Meetup you are asked to bring at least one dish that incorporates fresh herbs into it. Also please contribute a cocktail or bottle of wine if you wish to drink with us. 

I have included some recipe links to help you get started. Feel free to use any of these recipes or to use one of your own:

http://www.sunset.com/food-wine/kitchen-assistant/herb-recipes


http://www.marthastewart.com/274306/favorite-herb-recipes

This is a potluck party, but you may do finishing touches in the apartment. 


You can leave your food at Oprah's house if you wish to arrive early to enjoy the beach. 


The fine print:

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on the night of August 15th  Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

Let's take our practice outside this Sunday in Fort Lee Historic Park (NJ Palisades)!  Our lovely scenic lawn is awaiting us! Bring your mat or a beach towel and some water if the weather is hot.  Bug spray/tick repellent is a good idea too.  There haven't been mosquitoes, but deer to visit the area, so take precautions and check yourself after.  Yes, it's all worth it for some yoga in a magical outdoor spot!

We'll meet at 6PM at the Fort Lee Historic Park parking lot (park in the lot to the right) and will walk from there to a hidden lawn at the Southern-most point of the park with scenic overlook of the GW bridge, Manhattan skyline & Edgewater marina.  

DIRECTIONS (by car, walking, bike or public transportation): CLICK HERE or see picture below.  Meeting point is at the top of the ramp inside the park (where the star is on the picture).

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 6:15pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:30pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 3v3 with 6 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
* * * * * NOTE: Closed for renovations! * * * * * * *

On July 1, 2015, Robin's Nest closed for a combined renovation and vacation.

Thanks to trombonist Steve Johnson, I hear Robin's Nest is due to open back up on Sunday 8/16, so I've moved our meetup to the third Sunday this month.

Hope to see you there!

Photo Credit: Jazzville, NJ member, Maurice Jefferson

Robin's Nest in Linden is truly one of the friendliest venues we've ever been to. Walk in once and you're part of the family.

Plus, it doesn't hurt that the open jam session lets everyone join in the fun. Musicians and vocalists are invited to get on stage and join the band for a few songs.

Over the years, we've had members grace us with their talents and it's always fun to see someone you know join the band for a few numbers.

There is no cover and the food is excellent, so bring an appetite!

Your GPS is not misleading you

Robin's Nest is in a very residential area. Most first-timers think their GPS is taking them the wrong way. Just continue to follow it. Once you get to the club, it's very visible amongst all the houses.

A Note About Parking

It's a small lot and double parking is common. If you are on a time schedule, it's best to park on the street so you don't get blocked in.

The area around the club is very safe and there is plenty of space on the surrounding streets.

How To Find Us

Robin's Nest is a cozy little place, so you shouldn't have any trouble locating us, but if this is your first time joining the group, you might not recognize us right away.

Here are three easy ways to find us:

• look for the Jazzville, NJ Meetup sign: http://bit.ly/zBZxVL

• look for me: http://bit.ly/zP11QP

• ask at the bar for the "Jazzville, NJ Meetup" group

Don't be shy! Come introduce yourself and partake in the music and merryment!

peace and jazz,

D.A.
results.why: Robin's Nest is the place to be on Sunday evenings! If you're a singer or musician, you can join the band on stage. If you're not, just get ready to be blown away by the talent!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the door or the bar for the Jazzville Meetup group or look for the Meetup sign.
results.name: THIRD Sunday this month: Cool Jazz Open Jam @ Robin's Nest, Linden

group.name: Live, Old School Jazz with Jazzville, NJ!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 28-38 - 2f/1m spots left

On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drinks

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
In this 2h 30min educational yet personalized class, Chef Simon will teach you how to make authentic French pastries. Whether it is Paris-Brest, mille-feuille, chocolate eclair, chouquettes, madeleine, you have the opportunity to learn the preparation of these traditional treats. 

 Choux pastry, praline flavoured cream, puff pastry, and pastry cream will no longer be hidden secrets to you! Whether you are a beginner or a skilled baker, Chef Simon will help you to develop your potential. 

 Come experience a sweet culinary adventure in French baking!

Date: Aug 16 - 6:30pm - 2.5hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

Ticket available: https://goo.gl/f5ujFU

Tickets: https://goo.gl/OmSr0y

20% Off: HISUMMER

Making delicious macarons is a true art. The popularity of this French dessert has only exploded in the past few years. During this 2h 30min session, you will learn how to prepare, bake, and make this delightful and light pastry. Chef Simon will guide and teach you every step of the way in order for you to perfect the recipe behind this sophisticated delicacy. From whipping the meringue into the base to piping the shells onto a sheet and cooking an exquisite ganache, guests will acquire the essential techniques to be able to replicate the recipe at home. Sharpen your macaron cooking skills with Chef Simon! Book Now! 

Tickets: https://goo.gl/OmSr0y

results.description: Things are heated up at the "Hop". Great dance music from the 50's and 60's. Rock and Roll - Motown - R&B - Doo Wop - etc. 7:pm until 11:30.  at the Iguana Café.  The admission is $15. which includes $5. off house liquor, or beer / wine, or food, or two free sodas. Come on out and stimulate your "young at heart" nature.  Even if you are not an avid dancer, you will certainly enjoy listening to the music and watching us old folks dance. Don't stay at home on a Sunday evening..... Join me: look for the lady with the curly, curly hair and an orange flower (or hair flower). I will keep looking for you at the tables near the window.
results.how_to_find_us: After you pay your entrance fee....look for me at the tables near the windows.  I will wear a crown of Orange flowers and ribbons.   I might be up dancing but I will always keep comming back to the tables by the window.
results.name: Oldies but Goodies: "Sock Hop Sundays" Music and Dancing

results.description:
Things are heatin' up at The Hop!

Great dance music from the 50's & 60's! Including Rock-n-Roll, Motown, Soul, R&B, and Doo Wop.

7:00-11:30pm
Iguana Cafe
240 West 54th Street btwn Broadway & 8th Ave

Admission $15
which includes coupon for $5 off house liquor, or wine/beer, or 2 free sodas, or $5 off of any food

results.description:
This is an open class that’s appropriate for both newcomers and those who have experience with Tantra. There will be a brief introduction to Tantra and to Ipsalu Tantra for those that are new… plus a short discussion on a topic. We’ll follow that with a longer, juicier practice than usual! Wear comfortable clothing you can move around in. There is no sexual contact in these classes, but you’ll leave with your heart open and a smile on your face!

$20 at the door

Namaste!
results.name: Open Tantra Night

results.description:
SERIES LOGLINE:  In 1840's California, a timid housewife is left widowed after bandits rob her ranch. She heads north to seek out her brother, now the head of a wildly successful mining gang, but soon finds the route could prove fatal.  (1 Hour Historical Drama/Period Piece)


*Get ready to also discuss the Series Overview/Show Bible as well!*

ABOUT THE SCREENWRITER: Estella is a bilingual actress and screenwriter. She has written a feature film, GRINGAS, and two TV pilots, ICE and ORO. Her most recent TV pilot, "ICE," won the 2015 Showtime Tony Cox Screenwriting Award in the 1 Hour TV Pilot category and was a 2nd Rounder in the well-respected Austin Film Festival Screenwriting Competition, achieved by only 10% of 8,600 entries. ICE was also a quarter-finalist in the Slamdance Screenplay Competition, earning a spot in the top 25 for original teleplay. Estella’s period piece TV Pilot, ORO recently made it to the 2nd round of the Sundance Episodic Lab.

• Review the Script

• Talk about The Craft / The Business. 

To Do 

• Download the SCRIPT from our "FILES" section the week before our meeting. Read it and come prepared to give your constructive commentary.

• Members who bring written reviews go first. :)

• If you sign up after the PASSWORD email blast (1 week before meeting) then email/message [masked]. 

• Please do not distribute passwords, scripts, or materials you obtain from RSVPing to Collective workshops.

Thanks and see you soon!
results.name: "ORO" by Estella Gabriel (1 Hr Historical Drama)

results.description:
Ok folks, it's the third Sunday of the month, again- the day you all get to have a great time being being horrible people with a rousing game of Cards Against Humanity. Because so many of you enjoy it, we decided it was best to give you monthly recurring opportunities to be horrible. I'm sure we're doing a great service providing a safe outlet for these urges.

We'll be playing at The Uncommons, a tabletop gaming cafe. If by any chance Cards Against Humanity isn't your thing, they literally have a menu of dozens of games for you to enjoy, along with more typical menus for things like food and drink. For the small fee of $5 plus tax, all of these things will be available to you for the entire evening (The games, not the food and drink).

So come out and enjoy the guilty pleasure of being acceptably horrible with a card game, or play another game and sit in quiet judgment of the rest of us (both options have their appeal). Either way, join us for some fun games and good company this weekend.
results.name: Cards Against Humanity

results.description:
Teams are 7v7, 90min+ game. 2 or 3 teams (depending on final numbers). We rotate every 10 min games. Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt.


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal. Goals are 6' x 18'.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Each week dozens of CRC members and friends gather following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity to socialize, network and connect.  It is a great way to meet others in the group in a fun and casual way.

This week we will be going to Bella Luna who have donated to our charity events in the past.  Hang out at the bar and socialize or sit and have a bite to eat with the group, separate checks are no problem. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, Sunday is the best time to come on your own as almost everyone comes on their own.  Daisey will be on hand to welcome everyone old and new.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity Parish? No many of our members belong to other parishes.

What if I went to the earlier mass?  Not a problem, come for the gathering and enjoy food and drink

How do I pay for food and drinks?  We have worked it out so that you can all have separate checks if you choose to eat and drink

The group will meet on the sidewalk after mass (approx 6:30pm) then walk over together or you can meet us at the restaurant.

Daisey will be the host this week

results.description:
Is there anything you wish you had more of in life? More love? Peace? Fun? Money? Adventure? Better relationships?

Well, what if you already have everything you need to live your best life? Yup, you heard me! What if everything you need to make your dreams come alive is already inside of you? The only thing that keeps us from having what we want is Fear - and as a Certified Fearless Living Coach PC, I'm excited to share how Fearless Living changed my life...and how it can change yours! 

As Rhonda Britten (founder of the Fearless Living Institute) says, "No one can be Fearless alone!" - and you don't have to be!  All you need to join us is an open mind, a willing heart, and a desire to want something *more* in life.  You'll have the opportunity to learn one of the key concepts and self-empowering tools of Fearless Living - a skill that can be used to master emotional Fear in any situation!  

In addition, I'll be sharing my own personal journey to Freedom and encouraging group discussion as we meet new Fearless friends and support each other in pursuing our goals and dreams!  We'll also be discussing the way Fear keeps us 'stuck' and learning how to recognize when Fear is actually a marker for growth and opportunity - AND how we can use it to get the things we want! 

(This is a free event!)
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the lot behind the building, then go in the back door and down the stairs.
results.name: Turning Fear into Freedom - together!

group.name: Do YOU want to be Fearless?

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

-Carrying will be called

-Doubles will be called if too obvious

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches (Bottom Net is okay)

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

 This six week, progressive session will have 3 levels:


  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631564381

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">
results.name: Swing Dance Lessons @ the JCC levels 102 & 103

I want to thank everyone who came out for this, it was our first time at Stand UP New York Pro Headliner show, What a great meetup I met some of the most fun and amazing people the comics was a full top Comedy Central line up too. Were going to do this again pretty much every sunday from now on, and looks like they fixed their credit card machine. This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up, as you know I dont charge for this meetup, so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.


Ari Shaffir, Phil Hanley, Kyle Grooms, Ruperto Vanderpool James Goff, Godrey, Christian Finnegan, Jon Laster, and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs.

Show starts at 8pm sharp so please be on time! We can also do 10pm so if you all would prefer that for the future let me know.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Peace.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

results.description:
Last month I ran a free 5 day Nutrition Basics group on Facebook and many of you joined us and gave me some great feedback.  Well, I'll be running another one this month starting the 17th along with a few other friends/fellow coaches.  To any of you who didn't have a chance to participate in July, now's your chance to learn the basics about clean eating, basic nutrition and receive some great recipes too!  And I'm sure we'll throw in some other stuff too! 

Summer is nearing an end..I know I'm sad too,  before we know it September will be around the corner, so why not kick start our bodies and start living a healthier and happier life!  If you'd like to join us just RSVP "YES" to this meetup and friend request me on Facebook (Marsha Karen) and I'll add you to the group.  And the more the merrier. If you have any friends who you think would enjoy this free 5 day group please let me know (you can RSVP +1, etc) and have them friend me too.  My goals is to help you!

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class at Clove Lakes Park by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructor, Marie-Elena Aruta.   Bring a guest your first visit and your first class is 1/2 off.
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆$10.00 for a limited time only☆☆☆

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

results.description:
Oh, can't resist a fashion show!  And since I have so many students from China, I'm very interested on that score, too.  Come join me for staycation time :)

Here's what the website says: "This exhibition explores the impact of Chinese aesthetics on Western fashion and how China has fueled the fashionable imagination for centuries. In this collaboration between The Costume Institute and the Department of Asian Art, high fashion is juxtaposed with Chinese costumes, paintings, porcelains, and other art, including films, to reveal enchanting reflections of Chinese imagery.  From the earliest period of European contact with China in the sixteenth century, the West has been enchanted with enigmatic objects and imagery from the East, providing inspiration for fashion designers from Paul Poiret to Yves Saint Laurent, whose fashions are infused at every turn with romance, nostalgia, and make-believe. Through the looking glass of fashion, designers conjoin disparate stylistic references into a pastiche of Chinese aesthetic and cultural traditions. The exhibition features more than 140 examples of haute couture and avant-garde ready-to-wear alongside Chinese art. Filmic representations of China are incorporated throughout to reveal how our visions of China are framed by narratives that draw upon popular culture, and also to recognize the importance of cinema as a medium through which to understand the richness of Chinese history."

How to meet us: I'll be sitting on the lobby benches near the entrance to the Greco-Roman wing on the first floor of The Met, holding my hand-scrawled MEETUP sign. Please meet us by 11am. If you're late, ask a guard to direct you to the Looking Glass exhibit.

Admission: There is a suggested admission of $25 to enter the Met itself, but it is actually pay-what-you-will. That means pay what you want at the door, but you must pay something. We do also have our own $1 fee to help defray the costs of maintaining this meetup group, payable to the organizer.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a handwritten MEETUP sign
results.name: "China: Through the Looking Glass" at THE MET

results.description:
Our twice-monthly meeting of business professionals takes place from 4pm - 5pm in a private meeting room at the restaurant.

While there are many ways to make connections with potential new clients, nothing is better than having that prospect's trusted advisor pick up a phone or send an e-mail that says, "Here's someone you need to speak with about that problem you're having".  This is exactly what the members of Smart Transition Group do for each other.  We get to know each other, we get to trust each other, and then we share our most valuable resource... our clients.  

We all want to grow our businesses, but doing it personally, face-to-face, with people you trust and appreciate, makes it faster, easier, and far more effective.  Come learn more as a guest of the group at one of our upcoming meetings.  Bring your best-self, and a stack of business cards.

We'll take an opportunity to introduce ourselves and get to know other members. We will often have a featured member who will expand on the details of their business and help us to understand their buying signs so that we know who to think of when we hear them from our clients.

After a good discussion and a recap of the progress we will retire to the bar at Morton's for a drink and a more relaxed discussion. Some say, that's where the business really happens.

This is a great way to spend some time on a Monday afternoon growing your network and building alliances.
results.name: Monday Meetings at Morton's (The Steakhouse)

results.description:
Join us for a special networking Meet Up at Adorama featuring presentations by photographers Chris Gregory, Luiz C. Ribeiro, and Katie Orlinsky! There will be Adorama and AdoramaPix gift cards being raffled off and all those attending our event will get a 10% discount on a variety of items throughout the store. (Certain restrictions apply.) 

Watch it live online ➟ PhotoBrigade.com/LIVE! 

Christopher Gregory is a photographer based in New York City working extensively in his home-country of Puerto Rico as well as Latin America. His work focuses on exploiting photography’s application as a way to create documents. He sees the photograph as way to present artifacts and people who protagonize social issues, detonating a sense of guided discovery in viewers. He speaks English and Spanish natively and his clients include: Bloomberg Businessweek, The New York Times, National Public Radio and The Washington Post. 

Luiz Ribeiro is a full-time editorial and corporate photographer specializing in documentary, event, and travel. He also volunteers for non-profit organizations helping those in need. A former New York Post Staff Photographer and his photos have appeared in nearly every major national and international publication including, The New York Times, Los Angeles Times, Rolling Stone, Time Magazine, Newsweek, National Geographic Travel Guides.

Katie Orlinsky is a photographer and cinematographer from New York City. She received a Bachelor’s Degree in Political Science and Latin American Studies from Colorado College and a Masters degree in Journalism from Columbia University. Katie’s long-held interest in international politics and a desire to raise awareness on social issues originally led her to photography, and after college she moved to Mexico where she got her start as a photojournalist. Since then Katie has photographed personal projects, assignments and documentaries all over the world. Katie regularly works for the New York Times, the New Yorker, the Wall Street Journal, Al Jazeera America and a variety of international magazines and non-profit organizations such as the Too Young to Wed organization and campaign to end child marriage around the world. She has won numerous awards such as the 2014 ADC Young Guns Award, the 2013 PDN 30’s “New and Emerging Photographers to Watch," The Alexia Foundation 2012 Student Grant, The 2011 POYI Emerging Vision Incentive Award, the 2010 Prix Ani-PixPalace and the 2009 Coup de Couer at Visa Pour L’image. Katie is currently an Artist In Residence with the Levine/Leavitt artists' agency.

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/PhotoBrigade_HEAD%5B1%5D.jpg?itok=bKADUApv

The Photo Brigade is an amazing blog and resource for freelance photographers that showcase the amazing work of their talented network of photographers through features, guest posts, gear reviews, and podcasts, on the business of photography.

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

results.description:
This class will have fewer people and those who have learned the ropes will be able to jump right in with a lesson. The newcomers will get more of an evaluation. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, pizza, etc.

I have been asked to post this policy statement:

[[[ "Dear Members: This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.

For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...

Michael T. Harvey" ]]]

results.description:
*This is a volunteer meetup.  We need a minimum number of participants to get this going.  Please do not sign up unless you can really commit and do not bail the last minute unless you have a real emergency.*

*Please Note:  I have a strict policy for no showing in volunteering events.  Cancelling within 24 hours from start of event will be counted as no show.  Any member who doesn't bother to inform me about no show will be switched out to wait list for any future event that has approached full capacity, and can only get in if the event is not filled after RSVP,s closed.* 

We will be volunteering for Baby Buggy on the scheduled day from 6pm to 8pm.  Baby Buggy helps families in need by providing essential clothing, gear and services. 

Baby Buggy appreciates your help on different projects including:

• Patching clothing samples

• Cleaning gear

• Sorting clothing by age & gender

• Bundling books/games according to age

• Filling donation requests.

JC Writers writing marathons are about setting loose your inner writer-athlete and really getting some words down. You’ll be amazed at how much you can get done when you leave the distractions of home and spend a few hours in the company of other writers pounding away at their novels, short stories, screenplays and other works. The ensuring endorphins of accomplishment and sense of community with other writers will make you feel like you just ran a marathon, minus the jello-legs and carb cravings!!

Note: There is free parking for Zeppelin Hall!!

venue.name: Willa Cather Community Room at Jefferson Market Library

results.description:
Commemorating the Brooklyn bombshell’s August 17th birthday in the room where she faced a judge who sent her to jail.

During the 1920s, when Mae West was trying to build her career, the building all dramatists and actresses tried to avoid —Jefferson Market Court at 425 Sixth Avenue— was the very site that made a little-known performer world famous. When New York District Attorney Joab Banton had Mae West arrested and hauled in to Jefferson Market Police Court in a paddy wagon on February 9, 1927, the controversial Brooklyn entertainer made global headlines for the first time. The actress-writer also served time in Jefferson Market Jail. At her side, covering the trial for the New York Journal American, was Texas Guinan, Mae’s friend and a frequent passenger in the paddy wagon herself.

Though most Broadway headliners avoided negative publicity in the 1920s, these two diamond-draped divas flouted convention, defied the police, and became as well known for being handcuffed as for blazing their way onto marquees of the best theatres. They were “onstage outlaws” during the Prohibition Era.

 When Mae West [1893-1980] and Texas Guinan [1884-1933] weren’t being chastened by the purity police, they found time to enjoy the speakeasies, bookshops, restaurants, night spots, and theatres in Greenwich Village. A woman of restless energy, Texas-born Texas Guinan moved to New York in 1907, where she rented a room for $2 a week at 72 Washington Square South, and later moved to 17 West 8th St., where she lived in an antique-filled duplex. In addition to furs, ropes of pearls, and other jewelry, she wore bracelets on each wrist with 567 diamonds each and owned a fancy armored car that once belonged to the king of Belgium. Texas often partied with Mae at her own speakeasies, introducing the Brooklyn bombshell to Owney Madden, George Raft, and other men who would become useful.

This presentation will include rare vintage images showing the buildings and blocks around Washington Square as these two headline-makers saw them. Sites will include the Village speakeasies where Mae socialized and bent elbows with Texas Guinan, Walter Winchell, Jack Dempsey, George Raft, and Barney Gallant; significant theatres; the court rooms where Mae and Texas fought City Hall; and off-beat addresses that made an impact. Mae West’s Jefferson Market Jail poetry will also be read.

All programs are Free and Open to the Public.  Presented in the first floor Willa Cather Community Room.

The speaker LindaAnn Loschiavo is a Greenwich Village historian and dramatist; her plays include “Courting Mae West: Sex, Censorship, and Secrets” and “Diamond Lil, Queen of the Bowery.”

FREE!  Meet promptly at 6pm to get seats together and socialize (limited free refreshments will be provided; presentation begins ~6:30pm.


http://www.nypl.org/events/programs/2015/08/17/onstage-outlaws-mae-west-and-texas-guinan-during-lawless-prohibition-era
results.name: Onstage Outlaws: Mae West and Texas Guinan during the Lawless Prohibition Era
